Young Jesús Felipe is twenty-three years old, he is gay and says that he is not embarrassed of his sexual preference, he is proud of who he is since he considers himself to be a good person and friend to all who love him.

He has sold shoes wholesale and retail for about four years.

Jesús Felipe needs the loan to buy more shoes to sell.

He is grateful to the foundation for the support received through the organization that helps people without discriminating on peoples’ sexual preference and who they are since everyone deserves and opportunity to succeed in their respective businesses.

loans.use: buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda Avilania

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda  se  dedica a la venta de calzado desde hace tres años ,ella nos cuenta que le gusta mucho su negocio por que le deja buenas ganancias  y así  puede tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Esta felizmente casada con  el señor Gerardo un señor trabajador y humilde quien se dedica a las labores del campo.
Tambien se dedica a la venta de plantas y de madera.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra  de mas zapatos para la venta  por menudeo .
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudarla  para que crezca  su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yolanda has worked selling shoes for some three years. She says that she enjoys her work very much since she gets a good income and is able to have a better quality of life.

She is happily married to Mr. Gerardo, a hardworking and humble man who is a farmer.

Mrs. Yolanda also sells plants and lumber.

She needs the loan to buy more shoes to sell retail.

Mrs. Yolanda is grateful to the foundation for helping her business grow.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
La señorita  Leticia  es una persona trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de  ropa típica desde hace tres años .
Ella nos cuenta que le gusta mucho su negocio por que le deja buenas ganancias  y las personas esta muy contentas por la ropa que vende ya que están ellas por manos mexicanas.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas ropa para la venta por mayoreo  y menudeo como los clientes deseen.
Le da las gracias a  fundación por el apoyo que le da  a los jóvenes.
texts.en:
Ms. Leticia is a hardworking person who sells typical clothing; she has done this for some three years.

She says that she enjoys her work very much since she gets a good income and her customers are very happy with the clothing that she sells since they are made by Mexican hands.

Ms. Leticia needs the loan to buy more clothing to sell wholesale and retail, depending on her customers’ needs.

She is grateful to the foundation for the support granted to young people.

loans.use: buy typical clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maria Elva

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, queso y crema, vive acompañada de su esposo y sus tres hijos, tiene cinco años de estar en el negocio, vende de manera ambulante, inicio con el negocio por ideas propias, hasta el momento le ha ayudado a mantenerse ocupada y generar ganancias para su familia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en maíz, leña, queso y crema, con esta inversión podrá tener la suficiente cantidad de productos para el negocio, así atender la demanda y mantener la preferencia de los clientes.
La aspiración de María es encontrar la alternativa de  crecer en el negocio, apoyada por su esposo y que sus hijos se vean beneficiados.
texts.en:
María sells tortillas, cheese and cream. She lives with her husband and three children. For five years she has worked selling lumber as a roving salesperson, she stared the business on her own and so far it has helped her keep busy and generate income to support her family.

María needs a loan to buy corn, firewood, cheese and cream, with this investment she will have enough materials for her business and meet her customers’ needs and preferences.

María’s dream is to find way to make her business grow with the support of her husband and that her children benefit from her hard work.

loans.use: buy corn, firewood, cheese and cream.

loans.name: Mildren Midey

texts.es:
Mildren, vive con su esposo, trabaja en la elaboración de ollas, sartenes, comales, de barro, este oficio lo aprendió desde pequeña, trabaja a tiempo completo todos los días, ya que de esta actividad logra generar los ingresos para el sustento familiar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales como loza cruda, barro, nacazcol, con estos materiales ayudara a tener lo necesario para la elaboración de los productos, manteniendo lo necesario para continuar en el negocio.
El objetivo de Mildren es tener una buena inversión con el préstamo, que le ayude para realizar sus ventas y obtener dinero para aportar a su hogar.
texts.en:
Mildren lives with her husband. She makes earthenware pots, pans, and comales (a flat earthenware pan for cooking, like a griddle). Mildren learned her trade from a very young age; she works full time everyday since her work gives her the income necessary to support her family.

She needs a loan to buy materials like raw crockery, clay and nacazcol (a black dye) these materials will help her make her products, keeping what is necessary to keep her business going.

Mildren’s dream is to use her loan wisely and that it will help her sell her items and to have enough money from sales to support her home.

loans.use: buy materials like raw crockery, clay and nacazcol (a black dye).

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La señora Paulina es una señora trabajadora de sesenta años de edad se dedica a la siembra de maíz desde hace cinco años.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Sebastián con quien tiene  un hijo a quien desea darle un mejor futuro.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más maíz para la siembra ya que le deja buenas ganancias.
Le da las gracis afundacion por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Paulina is a hardworking sixty year old woman who has worked growing corn for five years.

She is happily married to Mr. Sebastián with whom she has a child and wishes to give a better future.

Mrs. Paulina needs the loan to buy more corn to grow since she receives good income from its sales.

She is grateful to the foundation for its support.

loans.use: buy more corn to grow.

loans.name: Etienne

texts.en:
Etienne is 30 years old and is married with two children. 

He owns a bakery business, selling cakes, bread and so on. This is his tenth year in this business and he works from 7 am until 9 pm every day. Etienne currently employs ten people to help him.

Etienne has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand his bakery business by buying more cakes, bread, etc to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To expand his bakery business by buying more cakes, bread, etc to sell.

loans.name: Eaunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 43 years old and married with three children. 

She sells scrap metal to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years and employs one person. Eunice also earns extra income from dairy farming. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy scrap metal for sale.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal for sale

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.fr:
Jean Marie Vianney est né au Rwanda. Il a 36 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 2 à 14 ans, dont 3 enfants sont scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de primaire.

Jean Marie Vianney est agriculteur. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter du ciment, des tôles et payer la main d’œuvre pour la réhabilitation de sa maison.

Dans les prochaines années, Jean Marie Vianney voudrait  continuer ses études. Avec les profits, il prévoit  de scolariser ses enfants jusqu’au haute niveau et améliore le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en: Jean Marie Vianney was born in Rwanda. He is 36 years old, and married with 6 children ranging from 2 to 14 years old, 3 of whom are in school. He himself completed 3 years of primary education. Jean Marie Vianney is a farmer. This is his first loan request from ACB. He will use his loan to purchase cement and corrugated sheets, and to pay the labour to repair his home. In the coming years, Jean Marie Vianney would like to continue his education. With his profits, he intends to put his children through school up to high school level, and to improve his family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy cement and corrugated sheets, and to pay the labour to repair his home.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is 41 years old, married and a mother of five children. 

She is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. Due to her good customer relations and quality services, she receives regular orders every month.

Her husband sells dried fruit. His shop is in the market from where he operates his business. Sughran has given birth to five children. Her eldest son has a job while the others are getting their education.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy dried fruit in larger quantities, which will allow him to make more profit by selling them.

The winter season is going on and the demand for dried fruit is high in the market. Sughran is confident that her husband will make a good profit from his business as a result of a loan.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits to sell

loans.name: Delfi Ethelvina

texts.es: Delfi Ethelvina, de 32 años de edad es casada tiene una hija ella se dedica a su negocio que es una tienda de trajes tipicos,y temporal mente se prepara en estas fechas con otras ventas que son regalitos y tambien con trajes de nuevos estilos ya que es lo que buscan sus clientes,y para esto nececita mas capital,por eso esta solicitando este credito ya que es una forma de obtener mas ganancias y poder crecer mas su negocio porque su sueño mas adelante es surtir mucho mas y que su tienda se convierta en un almacen,ya que ella se esta esforzando sola con su negocio porque su esposo esta en los estados unidos y le manda dinero porque estan contruyendo su local para que tenga un lugar bonito donde atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Delfi Ethelvina is 32 years old and is married. She has one daughter. She makes a living in her business which is a shop selling traditional costumes. She also seasonally prepares her shop around these dates to sell little presents and also new styles of costumes, as this is what her customers ask for. For this reason she need more work capital. 

She is requesting a loan as it is a way of obtaining higher income and helping her business grow. She has always dreamed of in the future having a much wider range of products and converting her shop into a warehouse. She is working alone in this business as her husband is in the United States and he sends her money because they are building a shop so she can have somewhere nice to serve her customers.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing for resale.

loans.name: Sop Sokhna Faty Issa Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de solidarité Sop Sokhna Faty Issa a été crée le 21 septembre 2010 le jour de la première Assemblée Générale du Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 11 femmes issues de la même localité qui se sont unies par des liens d’amitié et de voisinage. Elles exercent la même activité le petit commerce. Momy habillée en boubou noir debout à droite sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle fait le commerce de légumes au marché de Darou Mousty. Avec son prêt reçu, elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement acheter des légumes pour revendre au marché central de la ville. Ses bénéfices lui permettront de subvenir à ses besoins personnels, de renforcer son épargne dans le Banc Villageois et d'agrandir son activité.
texts.en: The community group Sop Sokhna Faty Issa was created on the 21st September 2010 - the day of the first General Assembly of the Banc Villageois. It is a group of 11 women coming from the same area, who are united by friendship and by being neighbours. They are all local traders. Momy, dressed in black traditional outfit and standing on the right in the photo, is the group leader. She is 36 years old. She is married and the mother of 3 children. She is a vegetable trader in the market at Darou Mousty. With her loan, she will increase her stock, buying vegetables in order to resell them in the town's central market. Her profits will allow her to cover her living expenses, to increase her savings with the Banc Villageois, and to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Duo Mujeres Con Talentos Group

texts.es: Duo Mujeres Con Talentos, Este Duo esta integrado por dos personas de las cuales esta doña Gloria Leticia,de 31 años de edad a lado de su esposo y con sus dos hijos se dedica a vender de forma ambulante,primero inicio son cosmeticos segun pedian los clientes,poco a poco incluyo a sus ventas ropa de tela para dama y niño,ahora incluyo la venta de blusas tipicas,en esta fecha ella siempre coloca su galeria en el parque del pueblo sus clientes le han pedido mas variedad de cosas pero ella no cuenta con el capital suficiente,el credito lo nececita para comprar ropa tipica,y surtur un poco mas su galeria, por su parte la señora ¿Deisy Leticia,tambien se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos en general de forma ambulante,espera que Fape y kiva le pueda ayudar dandoles el credito.
texts.en:
Duo Mujeres Con Talentos [Women With Talent Duo]:

This duo is formed of two women, one of whom is Gloris Leticia. She is 31 years old and lives with her husband and their two children. She makes a living as a street vendor. Initially she started selling cosmetics depending on her customers' orders. Then little by little she started including women's and children's clothing fabrics to her sales. Now she also sells traditional blouses. Around these dates she always sets up her stand in the village park. Her customers have ordered a variety of items from her but she does not have enough capital. She needs a loan to buy traditional clothing and to stock her stand. 

On the other hand, Deisy Leticia also makes a living selling cosmetics generally as a street vendor.

They hope that Fape and Kiva can help them by giving them a loan.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing for resale.

loans.name: Chocruz 1 Group

texts.es:
La señora Marta es soltera, tiene 26 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica a la agropecuaria, a la crianza de gallinas ponedoras y a la crianza de ce4rdos, inició este negocio criando pollos de engorde, y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de cerdos, ya que quiere ampliar su granja de animales domésticos. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y la producción agrícola.
texts.en:
Marta is single. She is 26 years old. She didn't have the chance to study and she makes a living in agriculture, raising laying hens and pigs. She started this business raising fattening chickens and has 6 years' experience to the day.

She is requesting a loan which she will use to buy pigs, as she wants to extend her domestic animal farm. The other members of the group make a living in agricultural production and trading.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Las "azucenas" Group

texts.es:
La señora Lucrecia es casada, tiene 28 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales no estudian, se dedica a la atención a una tienda en general, inicio este negocio vendiendo golosinas y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia, cuenta con al apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo negocio.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de productos para la tienda: aguas gaseosa, jugos, golosinas, lácteos, cereales, embutidos y otros productos, con el fin de mejorar sus ventas y ganancias, espera en el futuro contar con una tienda grande que venda por mayor. Las demás integrantes de grupo se dedican al comercio, crianza de animales y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Lucrecia is married and is 28 years old. She studied six years of primary education. She has two children who do not study. She makes a living running a general store. She started this business selling sweets and now has six years' experience. She relies on the support of her husband who also works in the same business.

She has organised a group to request a loan which she will use to buy products for her shop: soda water, juices, sweets, dairy products, cereals, cold meats and other products. She aims to improve her sales and earnings. She hopes to have a bigger store selling wholesale products in the future. The other members of the group make a living in trading and raising animals.

loans.use: to buy products for her shop: soda water, juices, sweets, dairy products, cereals, meats and other products.

loans.name: Duo Luz De La Esperanza Group

texts.es: Duo Luz de la Esperanza,Este Duo Esta Integrado por Dos personas Que dia a Dia Luchan por salir adelante,Tal Es El Caso de doña Fidelina,de 34 años de edad ella se dedica a la elavoracion de guipiles desde hace 5 años esta actividad ella nos cuenta que lo a realizado con mucho esmero ya que gracias a Dios poco a poco sus ventas han ido en aumento,el proposito de ayudar a su esposo y a sus hijos ya que el sueño de ella mas adelante es que sus hijos tengan mejores oportunidades,ella nos esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elavoracion de guipiles.de igual forma doña Antonia esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima ya que ella se dedica a la misma actividad que doña Fidelina.
texts.en:
Duo Luz de la Esperanza [Light of Hope Duo]

This duo is made up of two women who daily fight to get ahead. Such is the case that Fidelina, 34 years' old, makes a living making guipiles (traditional blouses), which she has done for the last five years. She tells us that she has carried out this work with dedication and thanks to God her sales have slowly increased. Her aim is to help her husband and their children. Her dream is that in the future her children can have better opportunities. She is requesting a loan to buy material to make guipilies. In the same way Antonia is requesting a loan to buy materials as she makes a living in the same activity as Fidelina.

loans.use: to buy materials to make guipiles (traditional blouses).

loans.name: Maria Irene

texts.es: Maria Irene,de 26 años de edad ella trabaja todos los dias en labado de ropa,tiene ya tiempo de dedicarse a esta actividad,tambien en sus ratos libres se dedica a cuidar sus animales en su casa,ella tiene un gran proposito para un futuro ya que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de animales para la crianza y luego cuando ya estan grandes venderlos a un mejor precio, y para la compra de alimentos para los mismos, ella nos cuenta que el mayor anhelo es tener un lugar mas grande para sus animales,y tener mayor capital para trabajar.
texts.en:
Maria Irene is 26 years old. She works every day washing clothes. She has made a living this way for some time. In her free time she looks after animals in her house. She has a great purpose for the future. 

She is requesting a loan to buy animals to raise and animal feed. Then when they are big she will sell them at a better price. She tells us that her biggest wish is to have a bigger place for her animals and to have more working capital.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es: Maria Juana,de 26 años de edad ella se dedica a la crianza de animales desde hace 5 años,y tambien se dedica a los bordados de manteles,ella nos cuenta que poco a poco a ido sobresaliendo en su negocito,ya que con el credito anterior pudo aumentar sus ventas un poco mas,y esta muy agradecida con la fundacion y Kiva por la ayuda brindada en el credito,de igual manera ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas animales y materia prima para la elavoracion de manteles.
texts.en:
Maria Juana is 26 years old and for the past five years she has made a living raising animals. She also embroiders tablecloths. She tells us that little by little she has excelled in her business. With a previous loan she was able to increase her sales a little more. 

She is very grateful to the MFI and Kiva for the help offered. In the same way she is now requesting a loan to buy more animals and material to make tablecloths.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and to buy material to make tablecloths.

loans.name: Duo Tu En Mi Group

texts.es: Duo Tu en Mi.Silvia Susana de 19 años de edad. ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos a parte de eso ella tambien se dedica al bordado de servietas,nos cuenta que ha luchado por salir adelante en su negocio y de la misma forma con su niño,ya que todavia nececita mucho cuidado,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de animales para la crianza,y compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos,al igual que la señora natalia tambien se dedica a la misma actividad,y es por eso que esta solicitando este credito,ellas esperan que fape y kiva les puedan ayudar con el credito solicitando.
texts.en:
Duo Tu en Mi.

Silvia Susana is 19 years old. She makes a living raising and selling chickens. Apart from this she also embroiders serviettes. She tells us that she has struggled to get ahead in her business and with her son. As he still needs a lot of care, she is requesting a loan to buy animals to raise and to buy materials to make fabrics. 

Natalia also makes a living in the same activity and for this reason they are requesting a loan. They hope that Fape and Kiva can help them with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and materials to make tablecloths.

loans.name: Diameguene Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de solidarité Diameguene a été créé le 10/12/2010.IL est composé de 14 femmes issus du même village. Le petit commerce est leur activité principale.Une parmi elles n'a pas bénéficié de prêt mais figure sur la photo. Elles ont pour responsable Nogaye âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et s'occupe de 07 enfants. Elle fait de la transformation d'huile d'arachide.Elle pratique cette activité depuis 10 ans et a une bonne expérience; elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en wax bleu et couverte d'un châle rouge.Son prêt va lui permettre d'acheter des arachides. Son objectif est de prendre en charge ses enfants.
texts.en: The Diameguene community group was created on the 10/12/2010. It is made up of 14 women from the same village. Their principal activity is local trade. One of them has not benefited from a loan but is in the photograph. Their leader is Nogaye who is 43 years old, married and she looks after 7 children. She is a producer of groundnut oil. She has been doing this for 10 years and has good experience; she is standing on the right of the photo dressed in a blue traditional dress and covered in a red shawl. Her loan will allow her to purchase groundnuts. Her objective is to take care of her children.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy jackets and bed covers for resale.

loans.name: Everianne

texts.en:
Everianne, 39, is married with four children aged between 6 and 17 years. Her business is well-organized. She sells clothes and works from 6am to 8pm every day. She has three years of experience in this business.

Everianne has requested a loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more second hand clothes for sale. With any profit from the loan, Everianne will be able to build her own house and to save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more second hand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Issabella

texts.en: Issabella, 43, is married with four children and engages in dairy farming to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and employs one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Issabella has been able to save her income and she hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Prisallah

texts.en: Prisallah, 48, sells men's and women's suits to earn a living. She has been in this business for 12 years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Prisallah has been able to grow her business and she hopes to expand it further in the future. She has applied for a loan of 25,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy men's and women's suits for resale.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's suits for resale.

loans.name: Eyvaz

texts.en:
Eyvaz, 45, is single and lives in a small village. He is a cattle breeder and has more than 10 years of experience raising and selling cattle. During these years, Eyvaz has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business.

Eyvaz usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them and sells the meat in the Agsu livestock bazaar. Looking after cattle is hard and requires spending a lot of time in the open air. The climate is very severe - very hot in summer and very cold in winter. However, Eyvaz is not alone in his business, as his father helps to pasture and feed the animals.

With a monthly profit is 300 Azerbaijani Manat (AZN), Eyvaz wishes to expand his business to improve the life of his family. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1800 AZN to purchase one milk cow, two cattle and fodder. This will be Eyvaz's fifth loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy one milk cow, two cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz is a 51-year-old man, married with four children. He is a market vendor who sells different kinds of goods such as shampoo, hair color, soap, some cosmetics, perfumes and home products. He has 11 years of experience and is considered to be an experienced and skilled person.

Mubariz usually buys his products from a wholesale market and then resells them for a profit in his own city. His wife helps him with selling goods.  His monthly profit from this business is 250 AZN. This is the only income in his family. 

Mubariz wishes to increase the number of products he carries and diversify what he sells to cover customers' demand. For this purpose, he has applied for 1000 AZN loan. He will use this loan to purchase more merchandise for his shop.

loans.use: to buy new products and diversify what he sells

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy computers and spare parts for them.

loans.name: Ricardo Adan

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo Adan es soltero, tiene 35 años de edad, estudió para maestro, se dedica a la tejeduría, cortes típicos y servilletas, inició este negocio por iniciativa propia, y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de hilos para tricotado y también hilo de alta seda y mish, espera en un futuro próximo tener  en negocio aun mas grande.
texts.en:
Ricardo Adan is single, 35 years old, studied to be a teacher and dedicates himself to weaving typical pieces and napkins.  He started this business under his own initiative and, until now, has 5 years of experience.

He requests a loan for the purchase of knitting yarn and silk threads.  In the future, he hopes to have a business that is even bigger.

loans.use: buy materials for knitting.

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en:
Shakir, 54, is married and lives with his wife and three children in a small city. He is a farmer who grows and sells fruits and vegetables from his garden. He has more than 30 years of experience in crop raising and is thus very experienced in this sphere.

Fresh fruits and vegetables are a most popular product and in high demand in Azerbaijan. People use them to make fresh juice, which is good for the health, as well as in national dishes like pilau and dolma. Shakir's father and wife help him to irrigate the plants and land and to run the business. His monthly profit is 320 Azerbaijani Manat (AZN).

Shakir has applied for a loan of 1500 AZN to purchase seeds and fertilizers. This will be his third loan with AqroInvest and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Electina

texts.en: Electina is a married woman. She has 6 children who range in age from 18 to 24 years old. She describes herself as innovative, kind and God-fearing. She operates a poultry retail business where she sells chickens and eggs. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to to buy more chicken feed and chickens to sell. Electina's business goal is to be a supplier of chickens within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more chicken feed and chickens to sell.

loans.name: Marta Albertina

texts.es:
La señora Marta Albertina está casada, tiene 25 años de edad, cursó sus estudios de educación primaria, tiene 1 hijo el cual aun no estudia, se dedica a la confección de tejidos como también al comercio, inicio este negocio gracias al tiempo que estuvo como trabajadora para  otro negocio, y hasta el momento cuenta con 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio

Decide solicitar un dinero como prestamos a ASDIR para ampliar su capital de trabajo, trabaja en la confección de camisas y playeras, va a comprar telas e hilos para confeccionar mas y poder vender más de su producto. En el futuro quiere que su pequeño negocio sea una empresa.
texts.en:
Marta Albertina is married, 25 years of age, completed her studies through elementary school, and has 1 son who is not yet in school.  She dedicates herself to making and selling woven items.  She started this business thanks to time she spent working for another company and, as of today, she counts on 10 years of experience.  She has the support of her husband, who dedicates himself to commerce.

She decided to request funds such as loans through ASDIR in order to augment her working capital.  She works making shirts and jerseys.  She is going to buy fabrics and thread for producing more items and to sell more of her products.  In the future, she hopes her small business becomes an enterprise.

loans.use: buy materials for production.

loans.name: Mazahir

texts.en:
Mazahir, 50, is married with three children. He raises fruits and vegetables in his garden and has been doing this for the last 15 years. He is a very experienced farmer and has a deep knowledge of land and how to operate it.

Mazahir usually grows seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them for a profit in the central bazaar. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and in high demand because people like to eat them every day and consider them very healthy. Also, one of the favorite national dishes, Dolma, is made of fresh eggplants, peppers and tomatoes. Mazahir's monthly income from this business is 340 Azerbaijani Manat (AZN). This is the only source of income in his family.

Mazahir would now like to invest more capital in his business and purchase seeds and fertilizers. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1000 AZN. As this is their sole source of income, he hopes this loan will improve the life of his family. This will be his second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan, 44, is married with three children. He raises cattle and also grows seasonal fruits and vegetables. With his 12 years of experience, he is considered an experienced and skilled person.

Elshan usually buys small calves and raises and resells them for a profit to local butchers. He also keeps cows and sells milk and yoghurt. Elshan has a bog garden where he raises his crops. He says that people buy these products depending on the season. For example, in autumn and winter meat and milk products are more popular, while in summer fresh homemade yoghurt is in high demand. Fruits and vegetables are popular all year long. His monthly income is 200 Azerbaijani Manat (AZN) per month.

Elshan applied for a loan of 1500 AZN to purchase one milk cow, two cattle and crops and fertilizers. This will be his third loan with AqroInvest and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase one milk cow, two cattle and crops and fertilizers.

loans.name: C9600 Kabare Ii Group

texts.en:
Dorothe is 41 years old and is married with six children between the ages of 2 and 18 years old.  Her business is well organized.  She sells potatoes and fruits.  She starts from 6am and works until 2pm every day except on Saturday. 

Dorothe is a leader of this group which is called C9600 KABARE II in local language and she is the second person from right side, first line.  She has twenty years of experience and she currently employs six people to help her.

Dorothe has requested a loan from Kiva via Vision Finance company in order to buy more fertilizer to cultivate large quantities of potatoes and fruits to sell.  With any profit, she will pay children's school fees and pay medical insurance for her family.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer to cultivate large quantities of potatoes and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Nob Sa Jeker Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de solidarité Nob Sa Jëkër a été créé le 10/12/10. Il est composé de 12 femmes issues de la même localité qui se sont unies par affinité. Elles exercent la même activité le petit commerce. Astou debout à droite sur la photo  est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle gère une alimentation. Ses bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans prise en charge des besoins de la famille et de renforcer son épargne dans le Banc Villageois.
texts.en: The Nob Sa Jëkër solidarity group was created on 12/10/2010.  It is made up of 12 women who come from the same area and are united by affinity.  They are all involved in small businesses.  Astou, standing on the right in the photo, is the facilitator of the group.  She is 30 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children.  She manages a grocery store.  Profits will allow her to help her husband to take care of the family's needs and will strengthen her savings with the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Roberta Eunice

texts.es:
La señora Roberta Eunice es casada, tiene 33 años de edad, cursó sus estudios de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la elaboración de canastas, lleva 1 año de experiencia en este negocio, espera  su negocio sea amplio.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de cintas y venas para mejorar su producción de canastas, quiere ver un negocio con mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Roberta Eunice is married, 33 years old, and completed her education through primary school; she has 2 children, and dedicates herself to making baskets.  She has 1 year of experience in this business, and hopes her business will be large.

She requests a loan that she will use to buy ribbon and lanyard straps to improve her production of baskets.  She wants to see a business that has better earnings.

loans.use: buy materials for making baskets.

loans.name: Vaqif

texts.en:
Vaqif, 52, is married with four children. He sells food products such as macaroni, butter, cookies, sugar, tea, candies and beverages in his shop. With eighteen years of experience in this field, he is considered a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The food products Vaqif sells are very popular and in high demand. His monthly profit from selling these foods is 350 Azerbaijani Manat (AZN). His wife helps him to sell products in the shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of his good location, in the central bazaar of his home city.

The profit Vaqif gains is not enough to reinvest in his business and covering his customer demand is suffering for this reason. Being the only source of income, his profit is used for family needs. Vaqif would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan of 1500 AZN to purchase and diversify additional foodstuff. This will be his third loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase additional foodstuff.

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en:
Sevda, 56, is married with four children. She is a market vendor and sells different kinds of foodstuff with candy, sausages, macaroni, tinned food and juices being the most popular products. Sevda has 15 years of experience selling food and during these years she gained the necessary experience and skills required to run a successful business. Her monthly income is 300 Azerbaijani Manat (AZN). She is not alone in her business as her elder son helps her to run it.

Sevda would like to diversify and purchase more food products. This will help to increase sales and improve the living conditions of her family. As she requires additional capital for this, she has applied for a loan of 1800 AZN. This will be her third loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy more goods.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man.  He has 2 children ranging in age from 5 years to 8 years old.  He describes himself to be innovative, kind and God fearing. 

He operates a grocery business where he sells vegetables and fruits.  He has been involved in this business for 5 years.  His business is located in a highly populated area and his primary customers are residents.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of vegetables and fruits.  He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits for selling.  John's business goal is to run a well stocked green grocery store within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fruits for selling.

loans.name: Ondong'a

texts.en:
Ondong'a is a 31 year old married man.  He describes himself to be deligent and independent.  

He operates a business where he sells chickens and eggs.  He has been involved in this business for 3 years.  His business is located in a highly populated area and his primary customers are residents and walkins.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of chicken feed. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase chickens and chicken feed.  Ondong'a  business goal is to run another similar poultry activity outlet within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feed and chickens for selling.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 40 year old single woman.  She describes herself to be a focused woman.  

She operates a rental houses service.  She has been involved in this business for 10 years.  Her business is located in a fast growing area and her primary customers are repeat and new.  She has one employee.  In addition, Margaret  provides car washing services. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital to finish up building houses.  She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase building materials to finish up construction of rental houses.  Margaret's business goal is to purchase another plot where she can run other rental houses within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy building materials to finish up construction of the rental houses.

loans.name: Arabia

texts.en:
Arabia is a 37 year old married woman.  She has 4 children ranging in age from 4 years to 13 years old.  She describes herself to be an ambitious and faithful woman. 

She operates a clothes store where she sells clothes.  She has been involved in this business for 7 years.  Her business is located in a viable area and her primary customers are local residents.  Arabia also runs rental services.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the clothing retail business.  She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more clothes for selling.  In the next five years, Arabia's  business goal is to run a boutique .

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Juana Aura

texts.es:
Doña Juana Aura, es casada, tiene 49 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos, 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la confección de tejidos, sudaderos, pants, playeras, etc. lleva 11 años de experiencia, inició siendo operaria, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica al comercio.

Quiere ampliar su producción, para lo cual acude ASDIR pra solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital de trabajo, ya que esta vez va a comprar: telas, hilos, correas, etiquetas, etc, las cuales son materiales necesarios e importantes en la producción de su negocio, ya que sin este material no tendría forma de producir mas prendas. Espera alcanzar su objetivo con el préstamo que esta realizando.
texts.en:
Juana Aura is married, 49 years old, and has 4 children, 2 of whom are in school.  She dedicates herself to making knitwear, sweatshirts, pants, jerseys, etc.  She has 11 years of experience, having started out as a machinist.  She counts on the support of her husband, who dedicates himself to commerce.

She wants to expand her production, for which she turns to ASDIR to request a loan that will help augment her working capital as, this time, she would like to buy:  fabrics, threads, straps, labels, etc.  These are necessary and important materials for the production of her business since, without these supplies, she would have no way to make her garments.  She hopes to reach her goal with the loan that she is realizing.

loans.use: buy supplies for making knitwear.

loans.name: Eufemia Margarita

texts.es: Doña Eufemia Margarita, ha logrado cancelar el credito anterior antes de tiempo por las buenas ganancias y ayuda económica de su esposo.  Esta muy feliz y muy agradecida en primer lugar con Dios y luego a todos ustedes donde sea que se encuentren por ayudarle a alcanzar sus sueños.  Ella cuenta que se aproxima  el inicio de clases y desea comprar muchas cosas para ofrecerles a los escolares, como mochilas, calsetas, cuadernos , lapiceros y todo tipo de ropa escolar.  Ella quiere surtir mas y mantener en crecimiento su negocio su esposo Jose Raul nunca la ha dejado sola siempre la apoya en todo y eso también la motiva a seguir adelante, la existencia del negocio le ha enseñado grandes lecciones por cada cliente que ella atiende, algunas malas pero mas buenas.  Su sueño como madre es darles lo mejor a sus hijas y verlas algún dia mujeres de éxito profesionales luchando por todos sus sueños, ella no tiene una carrera escolar por falta de dinero en su niñez, su mama no sabe leer ni escribir pero le heredo un tesoro hermoso la cual es el conocimiento de negociar y servir a las personas a travez de un negocio.
texts.en: Eufemia Margarita was able to pay off the previous loan early due to her good earnings and her husband's financial help. She is very happy and grateful first of all to God and later to all of you wherever you are, for helping her attain her dreams. She remarks that school will start soon and she wants to buy a lot of things to offer students, such as backpacks, socks, notebooks, pencil holders and all types of school clothing. She wants to stock her business more and keep it growing. Her husband, Jose Raul, has never left her side. He always supports her in everything and this motivates her to get ahead. The business has taught her big lessons for every customer she serves, some bad but most of them good. Her dream as a mother is to giver her daughters the best and see them one day become women with successful careers fighting for their dreams. She didn't finish school when she was a child due to a lack of money. Her mother doesn't know how to read or write but she inherited from her the beautiful treasure of knowing how to do business and serving people through the business.

loans.use: to buy all types of school supplies.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Duo Orquideas De San Bartolo Group

texts.es: Duo Orquideas de San Bartolo.Este duo esta integrado por dos personas las cuales esta doña Maria Llanuaria de 60 años de edad todavia tiene 2 hijos a su cargo que ambos llevan una carrera que terminar,doña Maria Llanuaria se dedica a la venta de Frutas y verduras,Flores, y huevos en la terminal de la zona 4,desde muy temprano ella sale de su pueblo y se dirige a su venta,ella nos cuenta que gracias a Fape y kiva a logrado hacer muchas cosas en su casa y sobre todo a sus hijos que estan por terminar su carrera,ella esta solicitando este nuevo credito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor y la compra de flores y huevos,al igual que la siguiente socia tambien se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras,y esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia para su venta.
texts.en: The Duo Orquideas is from San Bartolo. This duo is made up of two people, one of whom is Maria Llanuaria, 60 years old. She is still raising 2 children and both are in school. Maria Llanuaria sells fruit and vegetables, flowers and eggs in the Zone 4 terminal. She leaves her town very early in the morning and goes to sell. She tells us that thanks to Fape and Kiva, she has been able to do many things in her home and above all her children will soon finish their studies. She is asking for this new loan to buy more fruit and vegetables wholesale and to buy flowers and eggs. The other member also sells fruits and vegetables and is asking for this loan to buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables and eggs.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira, 55, is a widow with four children. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years, during which time she gained the knowledge and experience to be successful in her business.

Tahira started her business when her husband got sick many years ago. Then, the business started to bring income and now it is the only financial source in her family. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular among Azerbaijani people and they use them in everyday life, in punches and fresh juices. They consider them very healthy. Hence, demand for these kinds of products is very high. This business brings her family a monthly profit of 300 Azerbaijani Manat (AZN).

Now, Tahira has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand and increase her sales. She believes this loan will help to improve the lives of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand.

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en:
Clemence is a 37 year old married woman.  She has 3 children ranging in age from 3 to 10 years old.  She describes herself to be God fearing and honest. 

She operates a beauty saloon where she provides services such as plaiting, blowdrying, manicure, pedicure etc.  She has been involved in this business for 2 years.  Her business is located in a strategic area and her primary customers are local people.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be few customers turnover sometimes.  She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase beauty products such as hair oil, weaves. Clemence's business goal is to run a big beauty saloon within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products such as hair oil, weaves etc.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 56 year old married man.  He has 3 children ranging in age from 17 to 34 years old.  He describes himself to be regious man. 

He operates a tailoring service business where he sells clothes and provides services for repairing clothes.  He has been involved in this business for 15 years.  His business is located in a viable area and his primary customers are local residents.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be shortage of clothes materials for sewing.  He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase a sewing machine.  Jackson's business goal is to expand his business and to have two employees within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Heak

texts.en:
Heak, 31, is married and resides with her husband and three school-age children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples: Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey……).  

She has been running a business of renting mats for tourists for over two years.  Her husband is a construction worker.  In order improve her family livelihood, Heak is requesting for a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.  In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home to generate extra income to support the family.  In addition, she plans to buy a plot of land to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Hor

texts.en:
Hor, 48, is married and resides with his wife and six children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites(ancient temples: Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey……). 

He has been a motorbike mechanic for over five years and is successful in his career.  His wife is a homemaker.  His daughter is a sales staff in a beer company.  Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Hor is requesting for a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for his daughter to commute to work.  By doing so, his daughter would be able to go to work on time and save some money on her transportation expense to support the family. 

In the future, he would like to purchase motorbike spare parts to sell as well as to repair for his customers.  In addition, he hopes to rebuild his present house to make it much stronger and to provide better living conditions for the family and to support his children to higher education.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his daughter to commute to work

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
La señora Crecencia Margarita es casada, tiene, 39 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 1 estudia, se dedica a la artesanía a la elaboración de bordados en blusas, empezó su negocio, costurando blusas y ahora con el bordados lleva 6 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la construcción de vivienda.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima, consistente en hilos de alta seda y telas de diferentes clases y mejorar su producción de blusas con bordado.  Espera mejorar su negocio y quiere una empresa en el futuro las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales, confección de prendas, elaboración de bordados, y a la atención a tienda en general
texts.en:
Crecencia Margarita is married, 39 years old, and completed 3 years of elementary school.  She has 3 children, 1 of whom is in school.  She dedicates herself to handicrafts, making embroidered blouses.  She started her business sewing blouses and now has 6 years of experience with the embroidery.  She counts on the support of her husband, who is a construction worker.

She organized a group to be able to request a loan to buy raw materials such as silk thread, different types of fabric, and to improve her production of embroidered blouses.  She hopes to expand her business and wants a large enterprise in the future.  The other members of the group dedicate themselves, in general, to raising farm animals, clothing production, embroidery and shop keeping.

loans.use: buy silk threads for embroidery.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny, 56, is married and resides with her husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples: Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey……). She has been running a souvenir shop for over ten years and is successful in her career. Her husband is a policeman. 

In order to improve her business and generate more income to support the family, Ny is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more souvenirs to sell to tourists who come to visit the Khmer traditional temples in Siem Reap. In the future, she would like to rent one more store to sell souvenirs and to rebuild her present house to be much stronger in order to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more souvenirs to sell to tourists.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn, 38, is married and resides with her husband and three school-age children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples: Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey……). She has been employed at a massage shop for over five years, earning approximately USD 5.50 per day. Her husband has been employed in APSARA Authority for over two years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Sorn is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. By doing so, she would be able to save some money on her transportation expense to support the family. In the future, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en:
Sokhim, 30, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples: Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey……). She has been running a business of selling groceries for over ten years and is successful in her career. Her husband is a blacksmith. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sokhim is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike to use in her family as well as to carry groceries from the market to sell at home. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house. In addition, she plans to support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to use in her family as well as to carry groceries from the market to sell at home.

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
Nat, 24, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples: Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey……). She and her husband have been employed in a local organization for over five years. 

Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Nat is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work. By doing so, she would be able to save some money on her transportation expense to support the family. In the future, she would like to rent a store for selling souvenirs to generate extra income for the family. In addition, she plans to buy a plot of land to build a house and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock his clothing sales business.

loans.name: Sicalbe Cuatro Group

texts.es:
La señora Fabiana es casada, tiene 31 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 7 hijos 4 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la atención a una tienda en general, inició este negocio con un poco de capital y pocos productos y hasta el momento lleva 7 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

Decide organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que los utilizara para la compra de mas productos para la tienda: aguas gaseosas, jugos, golosinas, lácteos, azúcar, etc. Espera en el futuro tener una tienda grande con mas productos. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y a la agricultura.
texts.en:
Sra. Fabiana, 31, is married.  She never had a chance to go to school.  She has 7 children, 4 of whom are in school now.  She operates a corner store.  She started the business with only a few products and very little capital, but she's managed to keep it going for 7 years.  She and her husband, a farmer, rely on each other to cover their family's expenses.

Sra. Fabiana is a member of a community bank.  She is applying for a loan to stock her store with products--bottled water, juices, snacks, dairy products, sugar, etc.--that she will resell.  She wants to grow the business and open a larger store with a wider range of products.  The other members of the community bank are merchants and farmers.

loans.use: to stock her corner store.

loans.name: Savoeurn

texts.en:
Savoeurn, 30, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in growing agricultural crops for over seven years and are successful in their career. Additionally, her husband is involved in running a business of buying potatoes to resell at the market to generate more income to support the family. 

In order to help her husband’s business run smoothly, Savoeurn is requesting a loan of USD 650 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to carry potatoes to resell at the market. By doing so, her husband could easily carry potatoes in large amounts and generate extra profit to support the family. 

In the future, Savoeurn would like to invest more money in her husband’s business in order to purchase potatoes in larger amounts, rebuild her house to provide better living conditions for her family and to send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to carry potatoes for resale at the market.

loans.name: Samoun

texts.en:
Samoun, 42, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice for over ten years, has extensive experience, and is successful in her career. Her husband is a construction worker. Two of her children are employed at a garment factory. 

In order to improve her family’s economy, Samoun is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase pigs to breed in order to sell for a profitable price at the market. By doing so, she would be able to generate extra profit to support her family. In the future, she would like to purchase piglets to breed in order to sell when they gain weight. Moreover, she plans to expand her house with an upper floor and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to resell for a profitable price at the market.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sheep for her livestock business.

loans.name: Khen

texts.en: Khen, 31, is married and resides with her husband and three school-age children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice for over ten years and is successful in her career. Her husband is a photographer. In order to improve her husband’s business, Khen is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a camera for her husband to use in his business. In the future, she would like to purchase a photo printer for her husband to print photos for his clients. Moreover, she plans to renew her house and support her children to higher studies.

loans.use: to purchase a camera for her husband to use in his business.

loans.name: Samphors

texts.en:
Samphors, 34, is married and resides with her husband and three school-age children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in growing rice for over ten years and are successful in their career. Additionally, Samphors runs a grocery store at home to generate more income to support the family. 

In order to improve her family’s living conditions, Samphors is requesting a loan of USD 650 to purchase sows to breed in order to produce piglets to sell. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business, move her house to live next to a main street and support her children to higher studies.

loans.use: to purchase sows to breed in order to produce piglets to sell.

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her son’s snacks selling business. With the loan investment, he will buy cooking oil, potatoes and other items to be used in making snacks in larger quantities and of better quality. Shameem is very supportive and she helps her son in preparing snacks. She is hopeful that a loan investment will help him make more money from his business. Her younger son also works while her husband sells wheat, rice, etc.

Due to financial constraints, Shameem couldn’t educate her children. She is hopeful that by receiving a KIVA loan, her family’s financial life will be improved and she will be able to save some money for her son’s marriage in the future.

Note: "In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shameem.”

loans.use: To buy cooking oil and potatoes for a snacks making-and-selling business.

loans.name: Thary

texts.en: Thary, 40, is widowed and resides with her mother and five children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been running a grocery store for over twenty years and is successful in her career. In order to improve her family's living conditions, Thary is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to sell in order to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to purchase a new and bigger store to sell her groceries from. Moreover, she plans to build a new house and support her children to study until they get Bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sderng

texts.en:
Sderng, 30, is married and resides with her husband in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been running a grocery store for over two years and is successful in her career. Her husband is a construction worker. 

In order to improve her family economy, Sderng is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase piglets to raise in order to sell when they gain weight. By doing so, she would be able to generate more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house to provide a better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Thea

texts.en:
Thea is a farmer, while his wife, Dany, is a garment worker. They have been married since 1995 and have two daughters. The family lives in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Thea asked for a Kiva loan once already. He now is asking for another loan of $300 to organize his house by laying and plastering the brick and the wall in order to visually enhance it.

Photo: Thea is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To lay and plaster the brick and the wall in order to visually enhance it.

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s fruit selling business.

With the loan investment, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits for selling through his shop. He is a very hard worker and always provides fresh quality fruits to his clients at low rates. Mumtaz is hopeful that the loan investment will allow her husband to keep his products and services quality up-to-date and increase his income.

She supports her husband financially by sewing clothes. She is very good at her work and her skills help her get regular orders every month.

She has 2 daughters and 2 sons. She is hopeful that she will be able to send her children to school once her husband’s business gets improved as a result of the loan investment.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book called an Asasah Passbook is Mumtaz.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruits for fruit selling business

loans.name: Seap

texts.en:
Seap (in the photo) sells fish that her husband catches around the village. Her husband is a fisherman and grows rice when the rice farming season comes, and also raises cows at home.

She is asking for a loan in the amount of $500 to assist in her husband’s farming business by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide. 

The couple has been married since 1989. They live on the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to assist in her husband’s farming business by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Sareng

texts.en:
Sareng, 49, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in growing rice for over twenty years and are successful in their career. Five of her children are employed; three are garment workers and two are construction workers.

In order to improve her agricultural business, Sareng is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase fertilizer, supplements for rice and fuel for her agricultural machinery to use in her farming for the whole season. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business, renew her house and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, supplements for rice and fuel for her agricultural machinery to use in her farming.

loans.name: Aziz's Group

texts.en:
Aziz has requested loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her son’s tailoring business.

With the loan investment, her son will buy a sewing machine and also hire a worker that will allow him to complete the client orders on time and increase his income. He is very good in his services and receives large number of orders every month.  A worker and a new sewing machine will help him complete those orders on time.

Aziz is also a seamstress. She is expert in ladies' clothing and sews clothes for her community clients. Her husband does a job while her two children also contribute to the family financially by working.

Aziz is very hopeful that her family’s financial condition will improve with the betterment of her son’s tailoring business.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah Passbook is Aziz.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for tailoring business.

loans.name: Vanthet

texts.en:
Vanthet (in the photo with her loom), age 31, is single and lives with her sister and brother and widowed mother on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Vanthet is a weaver. She is asking for a loan of $500 to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Ving

texts.en:
Ving (pictured with her loom) is a weaver, while her husband, Vet, is a construction worker. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have three sons and one daughter. 

Ving is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to repair the house where she lives. She will also use a part of the loan to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: to repair the house where she lives and buy weaving materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Seik

texts.en:
Seik and her husband, Sophorn, are farmers. When free from farming, Seik weaves at home and her husband does construction work. The couple has been married since 1980 and has four children: two sons and two daughters. Two are married and live outside the family home and the other two attend school. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Seik is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,200 to help as capital for her son who is married and lives in a separate home. The loan will be used to buy additional grocery items for resale.

Photo: Seik, her granddaughter and her daughter.

loans.use: to help her son to buy additional grocery items for resale

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim (in the photo), age 32, is single and lives with his parents and sister in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. His parents are rice farmers.  

Lim is a rice farmer by assisting his parents. He is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Leyda De Jesus

texts.es:
Habitante de uno de los barrios populares y pintores de la ciudad de León llamada  barrio Subtiava es donde Leyda realiza sus actividades diarias, las cuales empiezan desde muy tempranas horas de la madrugada cuando se levanta para ir a molino para moler su maíz materia prima principal con que realiza sus sabrosas y calientitas tortillas. Ella tiene 38  años de edad, madre de dos hijos, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a este negocio. El cual inicio con ayuda de su esposo ya que ella era ama de casa, necesitaba un medio que genera ganancia para aportar en su hogar y sentirse independiente de su esposo.
Ella realizo el crédito para compra de maíz, leña, cal que son parte de la materia prima que necesita  para elaborar tortillas. Las condiciones de su humilde tortillería no son muy buenas pues necesita una mejor cocina con mejores condiciones se ha propuesto como meta comprar una cocina nueva. Luchar cada por darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Leyda is a resident of Subtiava, one of the most historic neighborhoods in Leon, Nicaragua's second city.  She gets up early every day to operate her tortilla business here, leaving at dawn for a local miller where she grinds maize, the main ingredient she needs to make her hot and delicious tortillas.  Leyda, 38, has two children.  She has operated her business for 10 years.  She started the business with help from her husband.  She was a housewife before and she needed a way to make an income, both to help with family expenses and to have an income of her own.   
Leyda received a loan that she used to buy the supplies--maize, firewood, etc.--she needed for her tortilla business.  Her kitchen isn't really suitable for her business and she would like to build a new one, but that's a goal for the future.  For now, her goal is to earn enough money to give her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tortilla business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy staple products in order to stock her general store with a greater variety of products.

loans.name: Takku Liggey Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de solidarité Tàkku Ligguèy a été crée le 10/12/10.Il est composé de 11 femmes issue de la même localité qui se sont unies par affinité, par des liens et d’amitié de voisinage. Elles exercent la même activité le petit commerce.Ndickou debout à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe.Elle est âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle fait le petit commerce de poulets et vends des beignets. Avec son prêt reçu, elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement acheter des poulets et de la farine pour faire des beignets. Ses bénéfices lui permettront de prendre en charge les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Tàkku Ligguèy was created on the 10th of December, 2010. It is made up of 11 women who live in the same area and are joined by bonds of affection, relationship and neighbourly friendship. They are all small traders.

Ndickou, standing on the right of the picture, is the group's leader. She is 34 years old, married and the mother of 2 children. She sells chickens and doughnuts. She will use her part of the loan to restock on chickens and buy flour with which to make doughnuts. Her profits will allow her to take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy chickens and flour.

loans.name: Yaye Dji Cheikh Group

texts.fr: Le groupe a été créé le 09/12/2010.IL est composé de 11 femmes issus du même village elles sont des parents elle ont une solidarité parfaite. Soda est la responsable du groupe debout à droite sur la photo, elle est âgée de 36 ans et à en charge 05 enfants. Elle a pour activité principale le petit commerce de légumes. Elle mène cette d'activité depuis 15 ans . Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des légumes pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Son objectif est de pouvoir renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
The Yaye Dji Cheikh group was created on the 9th of December, 2010. It is composed of 11 women who come from the same village, are all mothers and enjoy a strong bond of solidarity.

Soda, standing on the right of the picture, is the group's leader. She is 36 years old and is raising 5 children. Her principal business activity is selling vegetables and she has been doing this for 15 years. Her part of the loan will allow her to buy more vegetables to satisfy customer demand. Her aim is to be able to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Sop Sa Serigne Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de solidarité Sop Sa Serigne a été crée le10/12/10. Il est composé de 13femmes issue de la même localité, elles sont des amie, des parents. Elles exercent la même activité qui est le petit commerce. Ndioba debout à droite sur la photo la est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 46 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle fait le petit commerce de poisson séchés, de l'huile de palme en même temps elle fait de l'embouche, elle mène cette activité depuis 07 ans. Avec son prêt reçu, elle veut acheter du poisson et des sujets. Ses bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Sa Serigne was created on the 10th of December 2010. It is composed of 13 women who all come from the same village, are all friends with each other, and are mothers. They are all small retailers.

Ndioba, standing on the right of the picture, is the group´s leader. She is 46 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. She has been selling dried fish and palm oil, and practising animal fattening, for 7 years. She wants to use her part of the loan to buy fish and merchandise. Her profits will allow her to support her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and palm oil.

loans.name: Ameeran's Group

texts.en:
Ameeran is requesting a loan from Asasah, which she will use to buy a buffalo for her animal selling business. After the buffalo grows up, she will sell it. She will also sell its milk to community clients for extra income.

Ameeran has been operating this business for many years and has a lot of experience. Her customers are very happy because her animals are very healthy and provide good quality and quantities of milk.

Ameeran is hopeful that her husband’s business will improve further and her family will be able to live a  better financial life. She is a housewife but in her spare time, she offers full support to her husband in his business. She has two sons, the eldest is a farmer while her youngest son is 16 years old and stays at home.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo.

loans.name: Sop Mame Thierno Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de solidarité Sop Mame Thierno a été créé le 09/12/2010.IL est composé de 16 membres issus du même village, elles se sont unies par affinité, par voisinage et sont des parents.Awa est la responsable du groupement debout à droite sur la photo, elle est veuve âgée de 45 ans et à en charge 8 enfants dont 4 enfants et 4 petits fils. Elle a pour activité principale le petit commerce. Elle mène cette d'activité depuis 15ans.Son prêt lui permettra d‘acheter de la marchandise pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Son objectif est de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Mame Thierno was created 09/12/2010. It consists of 16 women from the same area. They are neighbors who all have children, and they got together based on affinities. 

Awa is the head of the group. She is the one standing at the right in the photo, Awa is a widow with 8 children in her care. Four are her children, and 4 are her grandsons. She is engaged in small trade, an activity she has been practicing for 15 years. 

With this loan, she intends to stock up on merchandise to meet customer demand. Her goals are to be able to provide for her family’s needs and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Josefa De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Josefa, casada, 47 años de edad, originaria de León, de oficio comerciante, vende maíz, trigo, leña, frijol, concentrados, sus hijos  están estudiando la secundaria. Tiene 13 años de tener su propio negocio en el cual su esposo la apoyado desde el principio antes ella trabajaba en el negocio familiar de venta de nacatamales pero decidió poner ella misma su negocio de manera independiente apara sacar adelante a sus hijos y aportar en su hogar ya que actualmente su esposo esta sin trabajo. 
Ella realizo el crédito para comprar maíz, trigo, frijol, leña y concentrado, ya que son los principales productos que vende. Una de sus expectativas es poner una abarrotería de granos básicos y productos comestibles. Para hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar los ingresos para el bienestar de su familia y los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Josefa, age 47, is from Leon, and she is married.  She is a merchant who sells corn, wheat, firewood, beans, and concentrates.  Her children are in high school.

She has had her own business for 13 years.  Her husband supported her from the beginning.  She used to work in the family business selling “nacatamales” (Nicaraguan style tamales).  However, she decided to establish her own business in an independent manner.  She did this in order to get her children ahead and to contribute to her household because her husband is currently without work.

The loan is to buy corn, wheat, beans, firewood, and concentrates.  These are the main products that she sells.  

One of her expectations is to establish a grocery store with basic grains and food products.  She will do this to make her business grow, to improve the income for her family’s well-being, and for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy corn, wheat, beans, firewood, and concentrates.

loans.name: Omar De Jesus

texts.es:
Omar es conocido en el sector donde trabaja por ser una persona que se esfuerza todos los días con tal de generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar, donde convive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos.
Omar siempre ha querido que su negocio sea reconocido por su buen servicio y la calidad de sus productos, y los clientes de Omar manifiesta que su servicio siempre es el mejor. 
Omar sueña con que sus hijos puedan acceder a una buena educación, y es por esto que siempre quiere generar ingresos extras para poder ahorrar para ello. 
Omar se desempeña en la venta de alimentos y jugos en el centro de la ciudad, y gracias a esta actividad genera los ingresos necesarios.
Omar aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de más productos como alimentos y los insumos necesarios para la preparación de sus jugos, de modo que sus ventas se incrementen y su negocio le genere más ingresos.
Omar aspira que con el aumento en sus ventas, su negocio le generará ingresos que le permitirán brindarles a su esposa y a sus 3 hijos la mejor calidad de vida, además de poder brindarles a sus hijos la mejor educación posibles.
texts.en:
Omar is known in his industry as a person who works hard every day to generate enough income to support his household, where he lives with his wife and three children.  He has always wanted his business to be famous for good service and quality products, and Omar's customers claim his service is always the best.

Omar's dream is to give his children a good education, and so he is always seeking to generate more income to be able to save for this purpose.  He sells food and juices in the city center and thanks to this business he is able to make enough income.

He believes a loan will give him the opportunity to buy more food and needed ingredients to make juices which will mean increased sales and more income.
