Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 60,000 Kenya Shillings to buy more shoes for resale.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wheat flour and rice for preparing food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy regular clothing and shirts for school uniforms, etc

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en: Ashot is involved in the agricultural business. He keeps cattle, beehives, and cultivates land. Ashot would like to develop cattle breeding. To implement this goal he has applied for a loan. Ashot plans to purchase three more cows. This will allow him to receive and sell more meat and milk and get additional income. Ashot will save up and invest in the development of other agricultural fields.

loans.use: to pay for cows and forage

loans.name: Vladik

texts.en: Vladik is involved in agriculture. He keeps a greenhouse and beehives. Vladik has applied for this loan to expand his farm and cultivate the land in the greenhouse. With the requested loan Vladik plans to purchase beehives, seeds and fuel. This loan will help Vladik to develop his farm and greenhouse and increase the income, which will help him to insure better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for beehives, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima lives in Aygestan village with her husband, son and daughter. The family gets its main income from agriculture: land cultivating and beekeeping. Rima wants to develop her farm and construct a greenhouse, where she will be able to cultivate and make sales during the winter season. This will allow Rima to get a stable income during the whole year and sustain her family.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and greenhouse construction

loans.name: Jonathan Isaac

texts.es:
Jonathan tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero.

Desde hace 10 años él se dedica a realizar actividades agrícolas, fue su papá quien le enseño. Jonathan siembra maíz, se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. a alimentar a sus animales, luego se va donde tiene sembrada su milpa, para llegar ahí debe caminar a pie cinco kilómetros y trabaja toda la mañana. En la tarde trabaja prestando sus servicios, con una yunta de bueyes y cobra por este servicio.

Para adquirir los insumos necesarios para sus cultivos, Jonathan se desplaza a una ciudad del oriente del país, para eso él camina a pie tres kilómetros, luego aborda un autobús hacia la ciudad, compra los insumos y se regresa a su vivienda.

Jonathan solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar fertilizantes y para rastrear la tierra donde sembrara y para pagar el alquiler de la tierra. Así él estará preparado para sembrar y obtendrá una buena cosecha que le permita aumentar sus ingresos, ya que Jonathan desea comprar una vaca para que le produzca leche y tener otro ingreso.
texts.en:
Jonathan is 20 years old and is single.

For ten years he has done agricultural work. It was his father who taught him. Jonathan plants corn. He gets up a 4 a.m. to feed his animals, then he leaves for the place where he plants his corn field. To get there, he has to walk on foot for five kilometers. He works all morning. In the afternoon he hires out his services with a pair of oxen, and he is paid for this work.

To acquire the necessary items for his fields, Jonathan travels to a city in the eastern part of the country; to do this, he walks by foot three kilometers, then he boards a bus to the city, buys his items, and returns to his house.

Jonathan is applying to Fundación Campo for a loan to buy fertilizers, to harrow the land where he will plant, and to pay for the rental of the land. Thus he will be ready to plant and he will obtain a good harvest, which will allow him to increase his income, since he wants to buy a cow, so that it will product milk for him and he will have another income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, to harrow the land where he will plant, and to pay to rent the land

loans.name: Hishigdalai

texts.en:
Hishigdalai is 26 years old and lives in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He started his bsusiness trading animal hides in 2010 by renting a counter in the market. Now, he's planning to sell meat. His initial business was trading wool, cashmere, leather etc which he got from herders. His suppliers are also able to provide him with meat and he has already rented a counter in the meat market. However he lacks cash to buy supplies. 

He is a sharp and hardworking man who says "my current income is not enough to support a family. I want to be ready when I settle down". He is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to buy a new stall for the sell meat and to purchase meat to sell.

loans.use: To buy a new stall and to buy meat to sell.

loans.name: Suvdmaa

texts.en:
Suvdmaa is forty-two years old and lives with her husband and three children in Govisumber province. Her husband is a wireman and two of her children study at high-school. 

She has ben running food cart business for four years. During the four years she has extended the business and now delivers food to local offices. Her further plan is to extend the business by having small building and serving customers with tasty good food. She already has regular customers. She is a hardworking lady who says that "I would like to extend my business so that I can save for my children's college fees". 

The total amount she is requesting is 600,000 MNT to buy meat for her meat trading business and a sofa for her house.

loans.use: To buy meat for her business and a sofa for her house.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 36-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 12 years. He describes himself as an honest and intelligent man. He operates a vehicle from which he provides motor vehicle repairs. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a very competitive area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more spare parts. Peter's business goal is to own his van within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motor vehicle repair.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit runs a bakery in Yerevan. She has been managing the business successfully during the past few years and now has a stable number of clients. In order to organize the bread making process more effectively and increase the quality of bread, Anahit wants to purchase new equipment. This will allow Anahit to make and sell more bread and get more business income. Development of the business will help Anahit to create better living conditions for her family. Anahit lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and little grandchild.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for her bakery

loans.name: Alphonce

texts.en: Alphonce is a 25-year-old married man. He has a daughter who is 2 months old. He describes himself as a diligent and visionary man. He operates a retail store where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a viable area. He is also employed as a private security guard to increase his income. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the stiff competition. He will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy 18 bags of charcoal. Alphonce's business goal is to be selling charcoal wholesale within five years.

loans.use: to buy 18 bags of charcoal for selling.

loans.name: Aramayis

texts.en: Aramayis is engaged in cattle breeding. Aramayis lives with his wife, who helps him with the agricultural business. Their son has left to work abroad and support the family. Aramayis would like to purchase more cattle and expand the farm. He also plans to purchase forage for the cattle. This will allow him to make the farm more profitable. Aramayis's family will greatly benefit from agricultural development, as this will allow his son to come back and get involved in agriculture too and live together with his family in his motherland.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and forage

loans.name: Grigor

texts.en: Grigor is a young retailer from Yerevan. He sells clothing from a rented booth in the city market. Grigor needs some financial investments to expand his business. With the loan's help, he plans to purchase clothing. This will allow Grigor to increase his sales and bring in more income which will be invested in the further development of the business.

loans.use: to pay for clothing

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 33-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 15 years. She describes herself as a God-fearing and humble woman. She operates a food stall where she sells food. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a residential area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be travelling long distances to sell food. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy ingredients for food. Elizabeth's business goal is to run a bigger restaurant in 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food for selling.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 25 years old. He does maize farming to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years and has employed one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a 35,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en: Marine is a young retailer from Yerevan. She sells clothing from a rented booth in the city market. Marine lives with her mother, father (who is a construction worker) and three brothers, who are students. Trading is an important part of the household's income and it helps to pay for Marine's brothers' education. Marine plans to increase her sales and bring in more income. For this reason, she plans to purchase clothing. Development of the business will help Marine to cover the family's costs and insure a more stable future for them.

loans.use: to pay for clothing

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 27 years old and married with one child, age 2. She runs a retail shop to earn a living and also does some farming to earn extra income. She describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a 10,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy sugar, tomatoes and a bar of soap.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tomatoes and a bar of soap

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en: Dickson is 23 years old and married with one child. He does quarrying to earn a living. He has been in the business for 2 years and has employed three people. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a 30,000 Kenyan shilling loan to rent land for quarrying.

loans.use: to rent land for quarrying

loans.name: Levon

texts.en: Levon lives in Kapan with his wife, son and daughter. He is engaged in beekeeping and pig breeding. Agriculture is the family's main income, and it is barely enough to cover the costs. So Levon wants to expand his farm and bring in more income. With the help of this loan, Levon plans to purchase beehives, pigs and forage. This will allow Levon to develop his agricultural business and get additional income, which will allow him to renovate his house and ensure better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for beehives, pigs and forage

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en: Jemma sells clothing. She has been in this business for already 20 years and has successfully managed and expanded it. Now Jemma would like to sells shoes too, and to purchase some sports clothing. This loan will help Jemma to increase her sales and bring in more income which will allow her to ensure a better future for her family. Jemma lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren.

loans.use: to pay for clothing and shoes

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Sambath, 42, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working in a church for over six years. They are pastors. Two of her children are employed: one is a garment worker and another one is a mobile phone repairer. Since the factory is far away from home, Sambath is requesting a loan of $1,000 US to purchase a motorbike for her child to commute to work. In the future, she hopes to build a new house to provide better living conditions for her family and to support her children's studies until they get Bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her child to commute to work

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run (in the photo), age 45, is a security guard and his wife, Sophat, age 44, stays at home and does the housework. They have been married since 1986 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. One works for a restaurant, two are security guards, one is a garment worker and another one attends school. The family lives in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Run is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Vanna, 47, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband has been a construction foreman for over ten years, earning approximately $6.50 US per day. In order to improve her family's living conditions, Vanna is requesting a loan of $1,000 US to purchase construction materials for building a bathroom and toilet. By doing so, she will have a hygienic toilet and bathroom to use. In the future, she hopes to rebuild her present house and support her children in  higher education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building her bathroom and toilet

loans.name: Soklim

texts.en: Soklim, 27, is married and lives with her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker, earning approximately $3 US per day. Her husband is a mechanic, earning approximately $4 US per day. Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Soklim is requesting a loan of $700 US to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work. By doing so, she will be able to save some money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she plans to rebuild her present house and support her children's studies until they get Bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Narou

texts.fr: Madame Narou  vit sur le territoire sénégalais. Elle est âgée  de 61 ans et s’active depuis 10 ans dans le commerce et la vente de produits divers( foulards, habits et tissus teintés). Elle a choisi son activité dans le souci de se procurer des revenus et subvenir a ses besoins et ainsi qu’a ceux de  sa famille. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou elle habite depuis aout 2005. Elle a déjà bénéficié de 6 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 500 000 frs prévu pour  le dédouanement de ses marchandises.  Les bénéfices que lui génère  son activité lui  ont  permis dans le passé   de régler beaucoup  de problèmes  familiaux.
texts.en:
Ms. Narou lives on Senegalese territory. She is 61 years old and has been active for ten years in commerce selling various goods (scarves, clothing, and dyed fabrics). She chose this business out of concern for acquiring revenues and for supporting herself, as well as her family. 

Since August 2005, Ms. Narou has been a member of the U-IMCEC branch office in the town where she lives. She has already benefited from six previous loans. 

She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to clear her merchandise from customs. The profit her business generates has previously enabled her to settle many family problems.

loans.use: to cover the customs fees for her merchandise

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 52 years old, married with four children. He owns and operates a maize mill machine to earn a living. He has been in the business for 14 years and has employed one person. He earns extra income from poultry farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 22,500 Kenya Shillings to buy a maize mill machine.

loans.use: To buy a maize mill machine.

loans.name: Ndeye Awa

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye Awa habite au Sénégal. Elle est âgée  de 37 ans. Elle a une double activité. Elle s’active dans le secteur de l’aviculture  et pratique en meme temps la vente de produits divers. Elle a choisi ses activités dans le but de se procurer des revenus et faire face a ses besoins personnels ainsi qu’a ceux de sa famille. C’est l’aspect lucratif et la  réalisation de bénéfices qui l’intéresse  surtout. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis octobre 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de poussins  pour les besoins de son activité avicole. Son souhait est de développer son activité avicole et accroitre ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Ms. Ndeye Awa lives in Senegal. She is 37 years old and has two businesses. She is active in the sector of poultry farming and at the same sells a variety of goods. She chose her work with the goal of having an income and coping with her needs, as well as those of her family. The lucrative aspect and profit-making are what interest her in particular. 

Ms. Ndeye Awa has been a member of a U-IMCEC branch office since October 2010. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to buy chicks for her poultry business. Her wish is to develop her poultry business and to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise

loans.name: Sovan

texts.en:
Sovan, age 42, is a garment worker and her husband, Ratana, age 40, is a fisherman (pictured together). They have been married since 1990 and have two sons and three daughters. Three of the children are garment workers and the others attend school. The family lives in a village about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sovan is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase additional materials for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La señora Emiliana es una señora trabajadora  de cincuenta y siete años de edad  se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace tres años.
Esta felizmente  casada con el señor Lucio un señor trabajador con quien tiene dos hijos a quien quiere y por quien trabaja.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más ropa para la venta..
texts.en:
Mrs. Emiliana is a fifty-seven year old hardworking woman who has sold clothing for three years.

She is happily married to Mr. Lucio, an industrious man with whom she has two children that she loves very much and are the driving force for all of her hard work.

Mrs. Emiliana needs the loan to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.use: buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sokim

texts.en:
Sokim, 34, is married with three school-aged children. She and her family reside in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Sokim and her husband have been involved in a successful agricultural business for over five years and have extensive experience growing rice and vegetables to sell. In addition, her husband is a fisherman. 

In order to improve her family economy, Sokim is requesting a loan of USD 800 to begin a new business by purchasing groceries to sell from home. By doing this, she would generate more income to support the family. In the future, she plans to purchase rice to store in a warehouse for resale later when the price is higher. Moreover, she hopes to support her children in their studies until they get their Bachelors' degrees.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell from home.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch is a 48-year-old married woman who resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. To earn a living, she has been making dip-nets (used to catch fish) to sell for over three years. Doing this she earns approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband, a construction worker, earns approximately USD 5 per day. Her children are also employed as construction workers. 

In order to improve her family living conditions, Touch is requesting for a loan of USD 800 to begin a new business purchasing groceries to sell from home. By doing this, she would generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business, build a new house and support her children while they study until they get their Bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell from home.

loans.name: Ana  Iris

texts.es:
La señora Ana  Iris tiene  treinta y dos años de edad, se dedica a la venta  de calzado por catalogo desde hace seis años.
Esta felizmente  casada con  el señor  Alberto un señor trabajador que se dedica a la venta de maíz.
Tiene dos hijos a los cuales quiere y trabaja ya que desea darles un mejor futuro.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más catálogos y calzado para la venta.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Iris is thirty-two years old and has worked selling shoes by catalogue for about six years.

She is happily married to Mr. Alberto, a hardworking man who sells corn.

Mrs. Ana Iris has two children whom she loves very much and are the driving force behind all of her hard work since she wants to give them a better life.

She needs a loan to buy more shoes by catalogue to sell to her customers.

Mrs. Ana Iris is grateful to the foundation for all of their support.

loans.use: buy shoes by catalogue.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha es una señora humilde de cuarenta años de edad, se dedica a la venta de  antojitos mexicanos desde  hace tres años.
Es  madre soltera  tiene  un hijo a quien quiere y por quien trabaja ya que desea ser un padre para el y que su hijo este orgullosa de ella.
Ella   nos cuenta qué la comida que vende es: enchiladas  verdes, enchiladas rojas, empadas, sopes y tacos dorados.
Ella pidió el préstamo para  la compra más ingredientes como son: chiles verdes, tomate, cebolla, ajo, queso y maíz para la elaboración para la elaboración de tortillas
Le da las gracias a fundacion por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha is a humble forty year old woman who has sold Mexican treats for three years.

She is a single mother to a son that she loves very much and is her reason for working since she wishes to be a father to him as well and that he be proud of her.

Mrs. Martha says that the food that she sells includes green and red enchiladas (like a corn pancake with chili), empanadas (fried corn cakes filled with meat), sopes (thick corn cakes), and tacos dorados (fried tacos).

She needs the loan to buy more ingredients like: green chilies, tomatoes, onion, garlic, cheese and corn to make tortillas.

Mrs. Martha is grateful to the foundation for all of their support.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Ivan De Jesus

texts.es:
Dedicado a su trabajo y a su familia es la mejor manera de identificar las cualidades de Iván. Un trabajador de toda la vida que siempre le ha querido brindar lo mejor a su familia. Iván, a sus 51 años de edad se encuentra casado y es padre de 2 hijos, por los que lucha constantemente con el ánimo de sacar su negocio adelante y generar mayores ingresos.
Iván se dedica a la venta de frutas en el centro de la ciudad, y manifiesta estar bien ubicado y tener clientela fija, sin embargo, la competencia es muy dura, pues son muchos puestos de ventas de frutas los que se encuentran en el sector. Iván siempre ha querido diversificar sus ventas, por lo que además de vender frutas, vende minutos de celular, de esta manera tiene un poco la ventaja sobre los demás competidores. Con el ánimo de generar más ingresos, aumentando la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes, Iván pretende comprar un congelado (nevera refrigerada) que le permita tener en su puesto una venta de pulpas de frutas, sin embargo, Iván no cuenta con el capital suficiente para ello, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le permita acceder a la compra de un congelado (nevera refrigerada) y el surtido de pulpas de frutas, de este modo será más atractivo para sus clientes y aumentará sus ventas.
Iván aspira a que con unos ingresos superiores a los actuales, pueda mejorarles la calidad de vida a su esposa y a sus hijos, además de que sus hijos puedan acceder a una educación universitaria y estudien una carrera que en un futuro les permita tener un empleo bien remunerado.
texts.en:
Dedicated to his work and family is the best way to describe Ivan. He is a life-long hard worker who has always wanted to provide the best for his family. Ivan, 52, is married and the father of 2 sons for whom he constantly fights, inspired to move his business forward and generate more income.  

Ivan sells fruit in the city’s downtown and states that he is well situated and has a fixed clientele. Nevertheless the competition is very stiff since there are many fruit stalls in the sector. Ivan has always wanted to diversify his sales so that besides selling fruit, he also sells cell phone minutes and in this way has a little bit of an advantage over competitors. With a desire to generate more income through expanding the variety of products that he offers his clients, Ivan wants to buy a freezer that will enable him to sell fruit pulp at his stall. However he does not have sufficient capital and is requesting a loan in order to buy a freezer and a supply of fruit pulp. In this way his business will be more attractive for his customers and he will increase his sales.

Ivan aspires to earn more income than he currently does, thereby improving the quality of life of his wife and sons. In addition, his sons will be able to have access to a university education and study for careers that in the future will help them have well paying jobs.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and supplies of fruit pulp, which will enable him to diversify the products he offers his customers.

loans.name: Honoria

texts.es:
La señora Honoria es una señora trabajadora  se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos desde hace  dos años.
Esta felizmente  casada  con el señor Epifanio  un señor humilde con quien tiene tres hijos.
Ella nos cuenta que la comida que vende es: tacos  de cecina, tacos dorados, empanadas, sopes, tostadas y enchiladas.
Pidió el préstamo  para la compra de más ingredientes como son: ajo, cebolla, tomate, queso, maiz para la elaboración de tortillas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Honoria is a hardworking woman who has sold Mexican treats for some two years.

She is happily married to Mr. Epifanio, a humble man with whom she has three children.

Mrs. Honoria says that she sells food like: tacos de cecina (salty dried meat tacos), tacos dorados (fried tacos), empanadas (fried corn cakes filled with meat), sopes (thick corn cakes), tostadas (fried tortilla pieces) and enchiladas (like a corn pancake with chili).

She needs the loan to buy more ingredients like: garlic, onions, cheese and corn to make tortillas.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch (in the photo) is a construction worker, while his wife, Onn, is a farmer. They live in a village across the Mekong River, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have one son and three daughters. Three of the children are married and one lives at home. 

In addition, Touch and his wife raise cows at home. Touch is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase one more cow to raise. When the cows give birth, he sells the calf

loans.use: To purchase one more cow to raise.

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mbaye est âgé de 43 ans et vit au Sénégal. Il est marié et évolue dans le secteur du commerce et la vente de friperie. Il a une expérience de 19 ans dans son activité qu’il a choisi dans le but de subvenir à ses besoins ainsi qu’a ceux de sa famille. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEc depuis septembre 2011. Il sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’habits de friperie  a commercialiser.
 Il souhaite augmenter le volume de son activité et faire face a la demande  croissante de ses clients en cette période de froid.
texts.en: Mbaye is 43 years old and lives in Senegal.  He is married and has been involved in the business of selling second-hand clothes for 19 years.  He chose this activity in order to take care of his own needs and to support his family.  He has been a member of one of the branches of the UIMCEC since September 2011.  He is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs in order to buy second-hand clothes for resale.  He wishes to increase the volume of his business and to meet his customers' growing demand during this cold season.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Sreypov (pictured above) works for a restaurant in Phnom Penh City. Her husband, Ra, is a garment worker. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have one son and two daughters. One of the children is in school and others are still young. 

Sreypov is asking for a loan of $300 to build a restroom for her family use.

loans.use: To build a restroom for her family use.

loans.name: Sokuntea

texts.en: Sokunthea, 33, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling traditional cakes for over 10 years, earning approximately US $5 per day. Her husband is a blacksmith and earns approximately US $5 per day. In order to finish her house building, Sokunthea is requesting for a loan of US $500 to purchase zinc roof tiles for covering her house’s wall. By doing so, she will have comfortable living conditions. In the future, she would like to expand her business to get extra profit to support the family.

loans.use: to purchase zinc roof tiles for her house

loans.name: Fatou Bintou

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Fatou Bintou est une jeune dame de 35 ans célibataire sans enfant, qui s’active dans la vente de poisson depuis  10 ans. Elle fait de l’ambulant : elle part dans les services et les maisons. 
Avec le crédit elle va acheter des caisses de poissons et augmenter son fond de roulement.
Elle n’a pas de charges sinon s’occuper de sa nourriture ; ce qui lui permet de bien gérer son petit commerce.
Elle pense un jour  hisser son commerce au plus haut niveau grâce à son épargne et à l’appui des financiers.
texts.en: Fatou Bintou, 35, is a young single woman with no children, who has been actively involved in the sale of fish for 10 years.  She sells door-to-door to businesses and people's homes.  With her loan, she will buy boxes of fish and increase her working capital.  She has no expenses other than buying her own food, which allows her to properly manage her little business.  Thanks to her savings and the financial support she is receiving, she is planning to take her business to a higher level sometimes in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish for door-to-door resale.

loans.name: Saream

texts.en: Saream, 32, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in growing rice for over 10 years and are successful in their career. Additionally, she has been carrying fish to sell around the village for over two years, earning approximately US $13 per day. In order to develop her family's economy, Saream is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase a trailer for her husband to run a delivery service to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to rent a store at the market to sell fish and stop carrying the fish to sell around the village. In addition, she would like to support her child to study at a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase a trailer for her husband to run a delivery service

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny, 56, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice for over 20 years and is successful in her career. Her husband is a road engineer. Two of her children are employed at the garment factory. Due to the lack of funds, Ny is asking for a loan of US $1200 for building her house. By doing so, her family will be provided comfortable living conditions. In the future, she would like to run a sewing shop at home to generate more income to support the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build her house

loans.name: Savoeurn

texts.en: Savoeurn, 32, is married and resides with her husband and one school-age child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been making baskets to sell for over 20 years, earning approximately US $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and earns approximately US $3 per day. Due to the lack of funds, Savoeurn is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase timber to build her house. By doing so, her family will be provided comfortable living conditions. In the future, she would like to raise her capital to purchase more baskets to sell to generate extra profit for the family and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build her house

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch (in the photo) and her husband Huon are farmers. They grow rice and sugarcane. In addition, Huon is also a fisherman, while Touch sells the fish that her husband caught. The couple lives across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh and they have eight children: four sons and four daughters.

Touch is asking for a loan of $400 to use on her sugar cane farm by buying buy seeds and paying for plowing fees.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Sok Noeurn

texts.en: Sok Noeurn, 32, is single and resides with her mother in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over 10 years, earning approximately US $3.50 per day. Her mother is a vegetable vendor, earning approximately US  $2.50 per day. Due to the lack of funds to finish her house building, Sok Noeurn is requesting a loan of US $800 to purchase construction materials to construct her house. By doing so, her family will be provided a comfortable living condition. In the future, she would like to raise capital for her mother’s business to purchase all kinds of vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to construct her house

loans.name: Garegin

texts.ru:
Гарегин родился в 1973 году в городе Капане. После окончания средней школы он поступил в Капанское профтехучилище, где получил специальность оператора станков.
В данный момент Гарегин вместе с семьей проживает в деревне Вардаванк, Сьюникского региона. У Гарегина трое детей: две дочери и сын. Сын учится на втором курсе Капанского колледжа, по окончании которого он получит специальность связиста. Обе дочери Гарегина учатся в школе. Жена Гарегина работает библиотекаршей в сельской библиотеке, а сам Гарегин работает в сельской общине. Мать Гарегина, проживающая вместе с ними, домохозяйка. 
С 2000 года Гарегин занимается сельским хозяйством: разводит крупный рогатый скот, овец, кур, свиней и пчел. Также он выращивает овощи и фрукты в собственном саду и огороде. Кроме этого Гарегин арендует участок земли, на котором он выращивает зерновые культуры: пшеницу и ячмень. Вся семья Гарегина помогает ему по мере возможностей. 
 Также у Гарегина имеется сельскохозяйственная техника, с помощью которой он предоставляет услуги в сфере сельскохозяйственных работ за плату.
Полученную сельскохозяйственную продукцию: овощи, фрукты, мясо, молоко, яйца, овечью шерсть, зерновые, и мед Гарегин продает своим постоянным клиентам и скупщикам в городе Капане. 
Кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм необходим Гарегину для покупки одной коровы и для капитального ремонта своей сельскохозяйственной техники.
texts.en:
Garegin was born in 1973 in the town of Kapan. After graduating from high school he enrolled in the Kapan vocational school where he got a degree as a machinery operator.

At the moment Garegin and his family live in the village of Vardavank in the Syuniksky region. Garegin has three children: two daughters and a son. Son is a sophomore at the college of Kapan after which he will graduate with a degree in communication. Two daughters of Garegin go to school. Garegin's wife works as a librarian in the village library and Garegin works in the rural community. Garegin's mother who lives with them is a housewife.

Since 2000 Garegin has been engaged in agriculture, he breeds large horned cattle, sheep, chickens, pigs and bees. He also grows vegetables and fruits in the garden and the orchard. In addition Garegin rents out a plot of land where he grows crops such as wheat and barley. The whole family helps Garegin as much as possible.

Also Garegin owns agricultural machinery which he uses to provide services in the field of agricultural work for a fee.

Garegin sells the collected agricultural products which are vegetables, fruits, meat, milk, eggs, wool, cereals and honey to his regular customers and buyers in the city of Kapan.

Garegin needs a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 dram (AMD) to buy a cow and to overhaul his agricultural machinery.

loans.use: to buy a cow and to repair agricultural equipment.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim, age 43, buys cows from his village and a nearby village, and sells them to a middleman who comes to buy them at his home. His wife, Sot, age 41, stays at home and does housework. They have been married since 1990 and have two sons. One is a garment worker and another is a construction worker. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Sim is asking for a loan of $1000 to buy additional cows for resale.

loans.use: to buy additional cows for resale.

loans.name: Jose Arcadio

texts.es:
José Arcadio se ha caracterizado por ser una persona dedicada a su hogar y sus hijos durante toda su vida, además de que tiene muy buena reputación por ser una persona muy trabajadora. 
José Arcadio fue abandonado por la madre de sus hijos, por lo que el se encuentra a cargo de sus 3 hijos y son ellos los que lo motivan para que todos los días trabaje fuertemente en su taller.
José Arcadio desde hace 39 años se dedica a la fabricación de calzado, y gracias a esto genera los ingresos necesarios para sostener los gastos de su hogar. José Arcadio tiene un taller de fabricación de calzado en el que tiene muy buenas ventas, gran parte de esto debido a la buena calidad de sus productos y a su buena atención a los clientes.
José Arcadio ha visto como se han aumentado sus ventas, por lo que tiene grandes pedidos de sus clientes por entregar. Debido a esto requiere comprar materiales e insumos para la fabricación del calzado, como lo es el caucho, el pegante, entre otros; sin embargo, José Arcadio no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder afrontar estas compras, por lo que tiene la esperanza de que un préstamo le permita acceder a la compra de los materiales necesarios para la fabricación del calzado como los son el caucho, el pegante, el cuero, entre otros, y poder así cumplirle a sus clientes sin tener que ver afectado sus ingresos mensuales.
José Arcadio tiene el gran sueño de que sus hijos puedan acceder a una educación de calidad, y que en un futuro tengan la posibilidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria. Además, José Arcadio sueña con que su taller pueda crecer y se consolide, de modo que genere grandes ingresos de los cuales sus hijos puedan obtener una estabilidad económica en un futuro.
texts.en:
José Arcadio is known as someone who has dedicated his life to his home and children.  He also has a very good reputation for being a hard worker.  He was abandoned by the mother of his children and so cares for the three who are his motivation for working so hard every day in his workshop.

For 39 years he has been making shoes and using the income to cover household expenses.  José Arcadio's shop has a very high sales volume because of the quality of his products and good customer service.  Since sales volume has increased he has large orders to fill and needs to buy materials and supplies to make shoes, such as rubber and glue, among other things.  But José Arcadio does not have enough capital to take on this purchase and he is hoping a loan will help him buy everything he needs such as rubber, glue, leather, etc., so he can fill customer orders without this affecting his monthly income.

His dream is for his children to receive a good education so they can go on to get a university degree.  He also wants to expand his workshop and turn it into a stable business that generates a good income for his children's economic stability in the future.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies to make shoes, such as rubber, leather, glue and other items.

loans.name: Mbithe

texts.en:
Mbithe is 51 years old and married with four children. She owns a grocery store and sells bananas and vegetables to earn a living. She has been in the business for 21 years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Mbithe has been able to save her income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 35,000 Kenya Shillings to buy bananas, onions and other vegetables.

loans.use: To buy bananas, onions and other vegetables.

loans.name: Rosa Candida

texts.es:
La señora Rosa tiene 34 años de edad, esta casada con tres hijos.

Desde hace 15 años se dedica al comercio, fue su mamá quien le enseño ya que ella hacia lo mismo. Las compras las realiza una vez por semana, ya que no hay transporte todos los días, ella se traslada a una ciudad del oriente del país que esta a 22 kilómetros del lugar donde vive.

Rosa solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar en mayor cantidad arroz, azúcar, sal, frijoles, jabón, entre otros productos más y la otra parte la invertirá en la instalación de un puesto de frutas y verduras en el centro de la ciudad. De esta manera la señora Rosa tendrá dos fuentes de ingresos y sus ganancias serán mayores. Permitiéndole inscribir a sus hijos a la escuela ya que en el lugar donde viven no hay escuela, ella los llevara al centro de la ciudad y como ahí instalara el negocio de frutas y verduras los tendrá cerca para que ellos continúen con su formación académica.

Rosa desea tener dos puestos de venta y con el tiempo mejorar su vivienda y ayudar para que sus hijos tengan lo necesario para una vida digna. También ella desea comprar dos vacas para comercializar con leche y sus derivados.
texts.en:
Rosa, 34, is married and has three children.  For 15 years she has worked as a merchant, a trade taught to her by her mother who was in the same business.  Transport is not available every day, so once a week she travels to a city in the eastern part of the country, 22 kilometers from where she lives, to buy the merchandise she needs.

Rosa is requesting a loan through Fundación Campo to buy bulk rice, sugar, salt, beans, soap and other products.  The rest of the loan will be used to set up a fruit and vegetable stall in the city center.  This way Rosas will have two sources of income and more profit, which will allow her to register her children in school in the city center since there is no school where they live. With her stall in the city she will have her children studying nearby.

Rosa wants to have two food stalls in the future and eventually renovate her home, while also helping her children to lead a better lifestyle.  She also wants to buy two cows to sell milk and dairy products.

loans.use: To buy bulk rice, sugar, salt, beans, soap and other products, and to set up a fruit and vegetable stall.

loans.name: Dora Tarcila

texts.es:
Dora ha sido una persona muy trabajadora durante toda su vida, y gracias a esto ha podido sacar adelante, junto con su esposo a sus 2 hijos. Dora siempre ha querido que sus 2 hijos puedan tener todo lo necesario, por lo que se esfuerza arduamente en su trabajo todos los días.
Dora ha trabajado en diferentes actividades con tal de generar los ingresos para su hogar. Anteriormente realizaba la venta de celulares y la reparación de los mismos, sin embargo el negocio no le daba suficientes ingresos. Es por esto que pasó a montar una farmacia que le permitiera acceder a mayores ingresos, y gracias a que ella y un hijo suyo conocían la actividad, la farmacia ha ido creciendo cada vez más y se ha ido consolidando en el sector. Gracias a su buena atención, y a la buena calidad de productos que ofrece, Dora ha podido atraer una gran clientela y hacer que su negocio sea reconocido. 
Actualmente Dora tiene muy buenas ventas, pero a menudo debe renunciar a algunos pedidos de sus clientes por no tener los productos que solicitan; es por esto que Dora quiere comprar productos farmacéuticos para su negocio, de modo que pueda responder a todos los requerimientos de sus clientes, sin embargo, Dora no cuenta con el capital suficiente para acceder a la compra de esta mercancía, por lo que tiene la esperanza puesta en que un préstamo le permitirá acceder a la compra de productos farmacéuticos y surtir así su negocio para que sus clientes puedan encontrar todas sus necesidades satisfechas en su negocio.
Dora aspira a que de esta manera sus ventas aumenten considerablemente, y de este modo pueda brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y su esposo. Además de permitirle a sus hijos acceder a una educación universitaria que les permita en un futuro conseguir un empleo que sea bien remunerado.
texts.en:
Dora has been a hardworking woman her whole life. Thanks to that, she has been able to get ahead with her husband and their 2 children. Dora has always wanted her 2 children to have everything they need, so she works hard at her job every day.  

Dora has worked at different activities to generate income for her home. Before, she sold cell phones and did cell phone repairs, but the business didn't let her have enough income. That is why she opened a pharmacy that allows her to access more income. Because she and one  of her children knew the business, the pharmacy has been growing and getting more stable in the area. Thanks to her good service and the good quality of the products she offers, Dora has been able to attract customers and make her business well known.
 
At present, Dora has very good sales, but at times she has to turn down orders from customers because she doesn't have the products they are asking for. That is why Dora wants to buy pharmaceutical products for her business so that she can respond to all of her customers' needs. Nonetheless, Dora doesn't have enough capital to purchase the merchandise. She hopes that the loan will allow her to access the purchase of pharmaceutical products and thus stock her business so that her customers can find everything they need in her business. 

Dora hopes to increase her sales significantly in this way and offer a better quality of life to her children and her husband. She also wants to offer her children a university education that will allow them to find well paid jobs in the future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of pharmaceuticals so that her customers can find what they need in her pharmacy.

loans.name: Ivan De Jesus

texts.es:
Ivan ha sido una persona que ha pasado por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo, su lucha constante y su capacidad de superación, han hecho que salga adelante. Ivan es un padre soltero que tiene a su cargo su hijo de 17 años, pues la madre los abandonó hace un tiempo. Es por esto que Ivan trabaja fuertemente todos los días con el ánimo de generar los ingresos necesarios para su hogar, donde convive con su madre y su hijo.
Ivan se dedica al trabajo de la confección a terceros, actividad que ejerce desde hace aproximadamente 13 años. Gracias a esto, Ivan obtiene los ingresos suficientes para brindarles a su madre y a su hijo todo lo que necesitan.
Ivan actualmente ha tenido muy buenos pedidos de sus clientes, sin embargo, algunos los ha tenido que rechazar debido a que no cuenta con las máquinas suficientes para hacer dichos trabajos. Es por esto que Ivan pretende comprar una máquina recubridora que le permita atender estos pedidos de sus clientes que ha tenido que rechazar, sin embargo, Ivan no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar la máquina, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de la máquina recubridora, de modo que no tendrá que rechazar los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, que requieren de esta máquina para realizar el trabajo.
Ivan sueña con que su negocio le pueda brindar mejores ingresos, de modo que le permita tener una mejor calidad de vida a su madre y su hijo. 
Además, Ivan sueña con que su hijo pueda acceder a una educación universitaria de calidad, y poder así estar preparado para que en un futuro obtenga un empleo bien remunerado.
texts.en:
Ivan has been a person who has gone through a lot of adversity in life. Nonetheless, his constant struggle and his ability to overcome have helped him to get ahead. Ivan is a single father who is raising his 17 year old son, since the boy's mother abandoned them a long time ago. That is why Ivan works hard everyday to generate income for his home, where he lives with his mother and son. 

Ivan works making clothing for people. He has done this for approximately 13 years. Thanks to this, Ivan obtains enough income to offer his mother and his son everything they need.

At present, Ivan has very good orders from his customers. Nonetheless, he has had to turn some down because he doesn't have enough machines to do the jobs. That is why Ivan intends to buy an overlocking sewing machine because it will allow him to fill those orders that he has had to turn down. Nonetheless, Ivan doesn't have enough capital to buy a machine, so he hopes that a loan will offer him the possibility of being able to buy the overlocking sewing machine, so that he won't have to turn down customers' orders that need that machine. 

Ivan dreams of his business generating more income, allowing him to give his mother and son a better quality of life. In addition, Ivan dreams of his son being able to access a university education and thus be prepared to have a well paid job in the future.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine that will allow him to fill his customers' orders that need this machine.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 23 years old and he sells bananas to earn a living. He has been in the business for 5 years and describes his business environment as busy because many customers visit him daily. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy bananas.

loans.use: To buy bananas.

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya, and a mother of six between the ages of 21 and 3 years. She has practiced farming for 6 years. Her farm produces milk, maize and beans, which are all sold within the local market.

Priscah has requested a second loan of 61,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow for 31,200 KES. She will also buy poultry birds at 30,000 KES to help her venture into poultry farming as well. She says the poultry business has a ready market in the area, but farmers shy away from it due to rampant poultry diseases. She says the additional dairy cow will help her family with milk for daily consumption and add into her income to meet other family needs.

Priscah says that the high costs of dairy feeds remain a challenge, especially during dry seasons.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow and buy poultry birds.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 28 years and he sells men's and women's jeans to earn a living. He has been in the business for 5 years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 10,000 Kenya Shillings to buy men's and women's jeans for resale.

loans.use: To buy men's and women's jeans for resale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ndeye Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye Fatou est âgée  de 32 ans. Elle vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 2 et 10 ans. Elle s’active dan le secteur du commerce et  vend de la pate d’arachide depuis cinq ans. Elle a chois cette  activité dans le but d’éviter d’être  inactive. Et ce qui l’intéresse  le plus  c’est  la réalisation des  bénéfices  qu’elle peut engendrer. Elle  est membre  d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mars 2008. Elle a déjà remboursé un crédit  antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour renforcer son fond de roulement. Elle compte acheter de l’arachide en quantité assez importante pour en faire de la pate. Cette opération pourra l’aider à augmenter considérablement ses bénéfices et améliorer la condition de vie sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndeye Fatou is 32 years old and lives in Senegal. She is married and the mother of 3 children aged between 2 and 10. She is a small retailer and has been selling peanut butter for 5 years. She chose this work so that she could stay busy. The aspect she finds most interesting about the work is the realisation of potential profits.

She has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since March 2008 and has already repaid a previous loan. She is requesting a loan of 100 000 francs which will strengthen her working capital. She plans to buy a large quantity of peanuts that she can turn into peanut butter. This would allow her to considerably increase her profits and improve her family´s social living conditions.

loans.use: to buy peanuts which which to make peanut butter for resale.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana, who is 49 years old, is married and has five children ranging from twelve to twenty-five years. She describes herself as a responsible, ambitious and confident woman. Previously, she was involved in primary farming activities. For the past twenty years, she has been selling vegetables in an urban area to new and repeat customers. In addition, she sells maize and beans to increase her income. 

Her grocery retail business is faced with the problem of the perishability of the vegetables sold. She will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more tomatoes, potatoes, kale and onions for selling. Her dream and hope is to be a supplier of vegetables to local schools and hotels in the future.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, potatoes, kale and onions for selling.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is aged 37 and married with 5 children between the ages of 18 and 5 years. She currently carries out her farming in her home area of Kitale and produces maize, beans and milk for the local market. She has carried out farming for 8 consecutive years.

Jane has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the additional dairy cow will help improve her family's living standards by providing basic family needs. She aspires to own five hybrid dairy cows in future.

However, she notes that animal feeds are quite costly during dry seasons and limits the cows' output significantly.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a farmer and a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya. She is married with 4 children and has been farming for 8 years. Her farm is currently run with the help of one farmhand and produces milk and maize, which are both sold within the local markets.

Elizabeth has requested a loan of 46,800 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says this will boost her dairy farming business. Previously she had acquired a loan of 46,600 KES, which she used to venture into dairy farming. She adds that she has gained more experience in the dairy business and hopes the second loan will earn better returns.

She notes that animal diseases remain a daunting challenge to farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a mother of 3 who are between the ages of 17 and 9 years. She is age 53 and has been active in farming for over ten years, producing and selling maize, beans and milk. Besides farming, she runs a secondhand clothing business. She says farming helps her meet most of her family's basic needs, like education and the provision of meals for her children.

Margaret has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds in order to venture into the poultry farming business, too. She says there is a ready market for poultry birds and eggs, and she hopes the business will raise her family's living standards.

However, she laments the high cost of supplies and the unreliable rains.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en: Tobias is 29 years old and married with one child. He does tailoring to earn a living, and he has been in the business for 3 years. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his income in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in the business for 6 years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 10,000 Kenya Shillings to buy tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Oun is aged 58 and widowed with five children. She lives in a village in the Thmor Koul district of Cambodia. Out of her five children, she has two daughters dependent on her and still studying in a primary school. She earns a living through farming rice as a primary business and selling cakes as secondary. She has been in this business for three years. With her current business, she can earn around nine U.S. dollars per day, but is able to save only around US$3 daily. 

This is a first loan for Oun’s group with Kiva’s field partner, VisionFund. Her group consists of two members and she is leading this group to apply for a loan of KHR1,000,000 each. As the leader, she plans to use this entire loan to pay for labor to harvest her rice crop. With this loan, Oun hopes to earn more income to increase her business and also keep her daughters in school.

loans.use: To pay for labor to harvest her rice crop.

loans.name: Gbenonvi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONVI est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Valerienne Afiavi est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Valerienne Afiavi est âgée de 51 ans et vit au Bénin. Valerienne Afiavi n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Valerienne Afiavi ne vit plus avec son mari, et a deux enfants, tous scolarisés dont un est à sa charge. Valerienne Afiavi vit seule avec son enfant à charge et assure seule ses différentes charges. Depuis une quinzaine d'année, Valerienne Afiavi vend des produits divers (conserves, savons) et des tissus par le système de distribution ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Valerienne Afiavi sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONVI, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les quatre premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Gbenonvi group is made up of 4 people who all live in the same area. This is the 5th time the group is requesting a loan from ALIDé in order to be able to increase their level of business activity.

The group's representative, Valerienne Afiavi, is the woman in the picture with her hand raised. She is 51 years old and lives in Benin. She did not go to school. She is the mother of 2 children, both of whom have attended school. She no longer lives with her husband and is currently raising one child. She lives alone with her child and is solely responsible for their expenses.

Valerienne Afiavi has been selling various products - canned goods, soaps and fabrics - via the distribution system for around 15 years; this enables her to take care of her needs and those of her child. In order to be able to satisfy her customers and increase her turnover and revenue, Valerienne Afiavi is requesting, together with the other members of the Gbenonvi group, a 5th loan from ALIDé. They have fully repaid their first 4 loans.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soaps and fabrics.

loans.name: Jesuwanon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUWANON est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Brigitte est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Brigitte est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Simon. Brigitte vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Brigitte mène comme activité depuis six ans environs la vente de plateaux d'œufs frais par le système de distribution. Cette activité lui permet de contribuer sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Brigitte s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Brigitte sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUWANON, un troisième crédit. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The group JESUWANON is made up of three people who live in the same area. This is the third time that the group is asking for the financial assistance of Alidé, in order to raise the level of their business activity. The representative of the group, named Brigitte, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Brigitte is forty-six years old and is married to a driver named Simon. Brigitte lives together with her husband and child. The couple has one child who is in school and in their care. The various expenses of the household are provided for by the couple. To manage this, Brigitte has run a business selling cartons of fresh eggs through a distribution system for around six years. This activity allows her to contribute to the needs of her family without great difficulty. Brigitte stocks up in a market in Benin. In seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her profits and revenue, Brigitte is asking for a third loan, together with the other members of the JESUWANON group. Their first two loans have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fresh eggs.

loans.name: Mame Yacine

texts.fr:
Madame Mame Yacine fait parti des premières  clientes du guichet. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Son mari qui est maitre coranique, l’a toujours soutenu dans ses activités.
Cette activité qui consiste à vendre de la bouillie épaisse et du couscous dans le quartier ou elle loge, elle l’a démarré depuis 3 ans de cela. 
Avec le crédit elle va se ravitailler en mil : un sac,  et va acheter aussi du bois pour pouvoir faire la cuisson. 
Elle n’a pas de charges et s’occupe d’elle-même et à améliorer son commerce.
texts.en:
Madame Mame Yacine is one of her branch's first clients. She is married and a mother of family. Her husband, who is a teacher of the Koran, has always supported her in her activities.
This business, which she started three years ago, consists of selling thick porridge and couscous in the area where she lives.
With the loan, she will purchase fresh supplies of millet (one bag), and is also going to buy wood in order to cook. She does not have anyone to support, and takes care of herself and improving her business.

loans.use: to buy millet and wood to make couscous and porridge to be sold.

loans.name: Marème

texts.fr: Marème est  une femme qui vit avec ses quatre enfants. Son mari étant décédé depuis deux ans.Elle exporte des céréales locales transformées et des produits halieutiques qu'elle envoie à sa soeur établie au Maroc.En retour cette dernière lui envoie des tissus.Elle pratique cette activité depuis un an et parvient à générer des revenus assez consistants qui lui permettent de se prendre en charge et de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.Afin d'augmenter son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un prêt de 500000f pour acheter 05 cartons de couscous ordinaire, 05 cartons de "couscous en boulette", 05 cartons de farine de mil, 20 kg de poisson séché et 15 kg de poisson fumé.Son ambition est d'ouvrir une grande unité de transformation des produits agricoles dans sa localité.
texts.en:
Marème lives with her 4 children. Her husband died 2 years ago. Marème exports local processed cereals and halieutic products to her sister who lives in Morocco and who, in turn, sends her fabrics. She has been in this line of work for a year and manages to earn consistent enough revenues to allow her to take care of her and her children´s needs.

Marème is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs to increase her working capital. She will use the loan to buy 5 boxes of regular couscous, 5 boxes of "couscous en boulette" (couscous dumplings), 5 boxes of millet flour, 20 kg of dried fish and 15 kg of smoked fish. Her ambition is to open a large processing plant in which to process the local agricultural produce.

loans.use: to buy 5 boxes of regular couscous, 5 boxes of "couscous en boulette", 5 boxes of millet flour, 20 kg of dried fish and 15 kg of smoked fish.

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en:
Phat, who lives in a village in the Thmor Koul district, is 39 years old and married. She has three dependent children who are still in school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice as a main source of income. Sometimes they work for others for a fee to better feed the family. They have been in this business for five years. Phat earns nearly $9 per day from her current business. 

Phat and her partner are the first cycled clients with Kiva’s field partner, VisionFund. They are requesting a loan of KHR 500,000 each. As the leader, Phat will use the entire loan to pay for labor to harvest her dry season rice. She hopes to harvest the rice crops on time and sell them for a good profit to set aside for the future and also to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To pay for labor to harvest her dry season rice.

loans.name: Peng's Group

texts.en:
The breadwinner of his family, Peng is a 56-year-old father of six children. He lives in a village in the Moung Russey district of Cambodia. His family earns a living through farming rice twice per year. They have been in this business for nearly 43 years. His wife and children work at other plantations to gain additional income. 

Peng received a loan from VisionFund three years ago and he successfully repaid the loan. Since 2009, the loan has made Peng's living better. He now earns around $5 per day and is able to save around $2.50 each day. He is now leading a group of three members to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, Peng is going to use this loan to buy fertilizer for his dry-season rice. With this loan, he hopes to earn more income to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his dry-season rice.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée, mère de 4 enfants dont les deux sont à l'école.Après avoir arrêté ses études en 2005, elle exerce un commerce de tissus, de bijoux et de sacs à main.Elle est appuyée par son mari qui lui écoule une partie de sa marchandise dans la ville ou il travaille.Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à certains de ses propres besoins de femme mais également de participer à la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de la famille.Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un prêt de 500000 francs auprès de l'UIMCEC pour l'achat de 50 sacs en cuir et 5 rouleaux de tissu. Son ambition est de se lancer dans l'import - export.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married woman and the mother of 4 children, 2 of whom go to school. She stopped her studies in 2005 and started selling fabrics, jewellery and handbags. She is helped by her husband who sells some of her merchandise in the town he works in. The business allows her to take care of some of her own needs and also to contribute to the household maintenance expenses.

In order to increase her working capital, she is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs from UIMCEC with which she will buy 50 leather handbags and 5 rolls of fabric. Her ambition is to get involved in the import/export business.

loans.use: to buy 50 leather handbags and 5 rolls of fabric.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Sandra es una persona reconocida entre sus familiares y amigos, por ser muy dedicada al bienestar de su hijo y el de sus padres. 
Con 33 años de edad, Sandra es una madre soltera cabeza de familia que debe velar por el bienestar de su hijo de 10 años, el cual afirma es la inspiración para trabajar arduamente todos los días en su negocio.
Con el ánimo de generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar, Sandra decidió montar una tienda de licores donde atiende gran cantidad de clientes y les ofrece productos como cervezas, aguardiente, ron, entre otros.
Sandra ha podido posicionar su negocio en el sector gracias a los buenos productos que ofrece y al buen servicio que presta, es por esto que sus clientes la tienen como un referente a la hora de consumir en el sector.
Sandra, con el ánimo de generar mayores ingresos para su familia, desea que su negocio se encuentre con más surtido de mercancía, además de cambiar algunas sillas que ya se encuentran en mal estado por el uso; sin embargo, Sandra se encuentra con un inconveniente que no le permite tener el capital suficiente para comprar estos productos, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de licores como son cervezas, aguardiente, ron, entre otros, y a la compra de unas nuevas sillas para amoblar su negocio, pues tiene unas sillas que ya se encuentran muy deterioradas.
Sandra tiene el sueño de que su hijo pueda acceder a una educación de calidad, por lo que quiere que su negocio le genere mayores ingresos para cumplir esto. Además, sueña con algún día poder tener su casa propia y desde la cual le pueda brindar a su hijo la mejor calidad de vida posible, y una estabilidad económica que le evite de pasar por las diferentes adversidades que ha pasado Sandra en su vida.
texts.en:
Sandra is well known among her friends and family because she looks out for the well-being of her son and parents.  She is 33 and a single mother who acts as head of family, looking out for her 10-year-old son who she says is her inspiration to work hard every day in her business.

In order to generate enough income to support her household Sandra decided to set up a liquor store where she attends to many customers, offering products such as beer, liquor, rum etc.

Sandra has been able to achieve her market share thanks to the quality products she offers along with good customer service.  Her customers consider her a leader within the industry. 

In order to generate more income for her family she wants to have a well-stocked business, and also change some of the chairs that are damaged.  The problem is that Sandra does not have enough capital to buy these products and so is requesting a loan to buy beer, liquor, rum, etc., and new chairs for her business.  The ones she has have become deteriorated.
 
Sandra's dream is for her son to get a quality education, so she wants to generate more income to make sure this is a possibility.  Also, in the future she wants to have her own home so she can give her son a better lifestyle and economic stability so he does not have to suffer the difficulties Sanda had in her life.

loans.use: To buy alcohol such as beer, liquor, rum, etc. for her business, and to buy chairs to replace damaged ones.

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond is 35 years old and married with three children. He runs a photocopy shop to earn a living. He has been in this business for three years and has employed one person. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Raymond has been able to expand his business. He hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a KES 50,000 loan to buy a photocopy machine.

loans.use: To buy a photocopy machine.

loans.name: Samut's Group

texts.en:
Samut is 43 years old and married with five children. She is a peasant who plants corn as her primary business to make a living. She supplements her income by selling grocery items such as soap, detergent, cake, candy, etc. She has been in this business for five years. 

This is a first loan for Samut’s group with Kiva’s field partner, VisionFund. Her group consists of herself and another female member who are applying for a loan of KHR 800,000 each. As the leader, Samut plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her corn healthfully and sell it for a good profit to earn a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a businessman who is married with two children. He owns a retail shop and sells sugar, tea leaves and maize flour to earn a living.

Nicholas has been in the business for four years. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a KES 20,000 loan to buy sugar, tea leaves and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, tea leaves and maize flour.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is 35 years old and the mother of three children. She runs a beauty salon to earn a living, and has been in this business for six years. She describes her business environment as busy because many customers visit her daily.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Carolyne has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of KES 42,000 to buy a hair dryer.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 27 years old and the mother of one child. She sells blouses and shirts to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and has employed one person. 

Grace does farming to earn extra income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy blouses and shirts to sell.

loans.use: To buy blouses and shirts to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is engaged in agriculture. She keeps cattle. Anna lives with her mother, brother, brother's wife and children. 

Anna has been engaged in cattle-breeding for four years. Through this period she has sustained her mother and brother's family. 

Now Anna would like to expand her farm and develop agriculture. With the loan's help, Anna will purchase cattle. This will allow Anna to earn more income and develop her farm further.

loans.use: to pay for cattle.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 30 years old and married with one child. He sells sweaters, trousers and blouses to earn a living. He has been in this business for eight years and describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a KES 80,000 loan to buy sweaters, trousers and blouses for sale.

loans.use: To buy sweaters, trousers and blouses for sale.

loans.name: Rodil Enrique

texts.es:
Rodil es una persona muy carismática que ha sido reconocido por su familia por siempre querer brindarles bienestar a las demás personas.
Rodil ha sido desde muy pequeño un buen trabajador, y se ha desempeñado en diferentes actividades. Gracias a un amigo que le enseñó la labor, Rodil ahora trabaja en la metalistería, actividad que le permite generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar, donde convive con su esposa. 
Rodil ha trabajado durante mucho tiempo como ayudante en un taller de metalistería, pero un día decidió independizarse y montó su propio taller. 
Desde entonces Rodil tiene su taller de metalistería donde tiene muy buenos clientes debido a su buen servicio y a la buena calidad que ofrece, y donde tiene muy buenos pedidos para realizar trabajos a sus clientes.
Actualmente Rodil tiene buenos pedidos de sus clientes, sin embargo, debido a que no posee la infraestructura completa para ofrecer el servicio completo a sus clientes, Rodil ve como no pueda contratar con sus clientes la fabricación de algunos productos. Es por esto que Rodil pretende acceder a la compra de una máquina rectificadora de cilindros que le permita tener los contratos de sus clientes, sin embargo, la máquina es muy costosa y Rodil apenas cuenta con aproximadamente el 60% de su valor. Por esto, Rodil tiene la esperanza de que un préstamo le permita acceder a la compra de la máquina rectificadora de cilindros y de esta manera pueda seguir teniendo todos los contratos con sus clientes.
Rodil sueña con que su negocio le genere grandes ingresos, de modo que le pueda mejorar la condición de vida que tiene su esposa actualmente, y también quiere que sus padres puedan obtener una mejor calidad de vida. 
Adicional a esto, Rodil sueña con tener su propia casa, donde pueda tener mayor privacidad con su esposa, y puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rodil is a very charismatic person who his family feels is always trying to help others.  Since he was very young he has always been a hard worker in different business activities.  Thanks to a friend who taught him the trade, Rodil now is involved in metalworks which allows him to generate enough income to cover household expenses for himself and his wife.

For many years he worked as a metal workshop assistant but decided to become independent and set up his own workshop.  Since then Rodil has been running his metal business and gaining many customers because of his quality work and customer service.  He receives many orders.

Currently, Rodil has many orders but does not have the infrastructure he would need to fill them, nor the resources to outsource the jobs.  So he wants to buy a cilinder grinding machine to attend to customer contracts.  The machine is very expensive and Rodil can barely cover 60% of the cost.  Therefore he is hoping to obtain a loan to buy the machine and fill customer orders.

Rodil's goal is for his business to generate a good income so he and his wife can have a better lifestyle.  He also wants his parents to have a better quality of life.
